DMATXPOLLDEMAND.description: When these bits are written with any value  the DMA reads the current descriptor to which the Register (Current Host Transmit Descriptor Register) is pointing. If that descriptor is not available (owned by the Host)  the transmission returns to the suspend state and Bit[2] (TU) of Status Register is asserted. If the descriptor is available  the transmission resumes.

DMARXPOLLDEMAND.description: When these bits are written with any value  the DMA reads the current descriptor to which the Current Host Receive Descriptor Register is pointing. If that descriptor is not available (owned by the Host)  the reception returns to the Suspended state and Bit[7] (RU) of Status Register is asserted. If the descriptor is available  the Rx DMA returns to the active state.

DMARXBASEADDR.description: This field contains the base address of the first descriptor in the Receive Descriptor list. The LSB Bits[1:0] are ignored and internally taken as all-zero by the DMA. Therefore these LSB bits are read-only.

DMATXBASEADDR.description: This field contains the base address of the first descriptor in the Transmit Descriptor list. The LSB Bits[1:0] are ignored and are internally taken as all-zero by the DMA.Therefore  these LSB bits are read-only.

DMASTATUS.description: State of interrupts, errors and other events

DMAOPERATION_MODE.description: Receive and Transmit operating modes and command

DMAIN_EN.description: When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[16])  the Transmit Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Transmit Interrupt is disabled.

DMAMISSEDFR.description: Missed Frame and Buffer Overflow Counter Register

DMATXCURRDESC.description: The address of the current receive descriptor list. Cleared on Reset.Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.

DMARXCURRDESC.description: The address of the current receive descriptor list. Cleared on Reset.Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.

DMATXCURRADDR_BUF.description: The address of the current receive descriptor list. Cleared on Reset.Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.

DMARXCURRADDR_BUF.description: The address of the current receive descriptor list. Cleared on Reset.Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.

SW_RST.description: When this bit is set  the MAC DMA Controller resets the logic and all internal registers of the MAC. It is cleared automatically after the reset operation is complete in all of the ETH_MAC clock domains. Before reprogramming any register of the ETH_MAC  you should read a zero (0) value in this bit.

DMA_ARB_SCH.description: This bit specifies the arbitration scheme between the transmit and receive paths.1'b0: weighted round-robin with RX:TX or TX:RX  priority specified in PR (bit[15:14]). 1'b1 Fixed priority (Rx priority to Tx).

DESC_SKIP_LEN.description: This bit specifies the number of Word to skip between two unchained descriptors.The address skipping starts from the end of current descriptor to the start of next descriptor. When the DSL(DESC_SKIP_LEN) value is equal to zero  the descriptor table is taken as contiguous by the DMA in Ring mode.

ALT_DESC_SIZE.description: When set  the size of the alternate descriptor increases to 32 bytes.

PROG_BURST_LEN.description: These bits indicate the maximum number of beats to be transferred in one DMA transaction. If the number of beats to be transferred is more than 32  then perform the following steps: 1. Set the PBLx8 mode  2. Set the PBL(PROG_BURST_LEN).

PRI_RATIO.description: These bits control the priority ratio in the weighted round-robin arbitration between the Rx DMA and Tx DMA. These bits are valid only when Bit 1 (DA) is reset. The priority ratio Rx:Tx represented by each bit:  2'b00 -- 1: 1    2'b01 -- 2: 0    2'b10 -- 3: 1    2'b11 -- 4: 1

FIXED_BURST.description: This bit controls whether the AHB master interface performs fixed burst transfers or not. When set  the AHB interface uses only SINGLE  INCR4  INCR8  or INCR16 during start of the normal burst transfers. When reset  the AHB interface uses SINGLE and INCR burst transfer Operations.

RX_DMA_PBL.description: This field indicates the maximum number of beats to be transferred in one Rx DMA transaction. This is the maximum value that is used in a single block Read or Write.The Rx DMA always attempts to burst as specified in the RPBL(RX_DMA_PBL) bit each time it starts a burst transfer on the host bus. You can program RPBL with values of 1  2  4  8  16  and 32. Any other value results in undefined behavior. This field is valid and applicable only when USP(USE_SEP_PBL) is set high.

USE_SEP_PBL.description: When set high  this bit configures the Rx DMA to use the value configured in Bits[22:17] as PBL. The PBL value in Bits[13:8] is applicable only to the Tx DMA operations. When reset to low  the PBL value in Bits[13:8] is applicable for both DMA engines.

PBLX8_MODE.description: When set high  this bit multiplies the programmed PBL value (Bits[22:17] and Bits[13:8]) eight times. Therefore  the DMA transfers the data in 8  16  32  64  128  and 256 beats depending on the PBL value.

DMAADDRALIBEA.description: When this bit is set high and the FIXED_BURST bit is 1  the AHB interface generates all bursts aligned to the start address LS bits. If the FIXED_BURST bit is 0  the first burst (accessing the start address of data buffer) is not aligned  but subsequent bursts are aligned to the address.

DMAMIXEDBURST.description: When this bit is set high and the FIXED_BURST bit is low  the AHB master interface starts all bursts of a length more than 16 with INCR (undefined burst)  whereas it reverts to fixed burst transfers (INCRx and SINGLE) for burst length of 16 and less.

TRANS_INT.description: This bit indicates that the frame transmission is complete. When transmission is complete  Bit[31] (OWN) of TDES0 is reset  and the specific frame status information is updated in the Descriptor.

TRANS_PROC_STOP.description: This bit is set when the transmission is stopped.

TRANS_BUF_UNAVAIL.description: This bit indicates that the host owns the Next Descriptor in the Transmit List and the DMA cannot acquire it. Transmission is suspended. Bits[22:20] explain the Transmit Process state transitions. To resume processing Transmit descriptors  the host should change the ownership of the descriptor by setting TDES0[31] and then issue a Transmit Poll Demand Command.

TRANS_JABBER_TO.description: This bit indicates that the Transmit Jabber Timer expired  which happens when the frame size exceeds 2 048 (10 240 bytes when the Jumbo frame is enabled). When the Jabber Timeout occurs  the transmission process is aborted and placed in the Stopped state. This causes the Transmit Jabber Timeout TDES0[14] flag to assert.

RECV_OVFLOW.description: This bit indicates that the Receive Buffer had an Overflow during frame reception. If the partial frame is transferred to the application  the overflow status is set in RDES0[11].

TRANS_UNDFLOW.description: This bit indicates that the Transmit Buffer had an Underflow during frame transmission. Transmission is suspended and an Underflow Error TDES0[1] is set.

RECV_INT.description: This bit indicates that the frame reception is complete. When reception is complete  the Bit[31] of RDES1 (Disable Interrupt on Completion) is reset in the last Descriptor  and the specific frame status information is updated in the descriptor. The reception remains in the Running state.

RECV_BUF_UNAVAIL.description: This bit indicates that the host owns the Next Descriptor in the Receive List and the DMA cannot acquire it. The Receive Process is suspended. To resume processing Receive descriptors  the host should change the ownership of the descriptor and issue a Receive Poll Demand command. If no Receive Poll Demand is issued  the Receive Process resumes when the next recognized incoming frame is received. This bit is set only when the previous Receive Descriptor is owned by the DMA.

RECV_PROC_STOP.description: This bit is asserted when the Receive Process enters the Stopped state.

RECV_WDT_TO.description: When set  this bit indicates that the Receive Watchdog Timer expired while receiving the current frame and the current frame is truncated after the watchdog timeout.

EARLY_TRANS_INT.description: This bit indicates that the frame to be transmitted is fully transferred to the MTL Transmit FIFO.

FATAL_BUS_ERR_INT.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred  as described in Bits [25:23]. When this bit is set  the corresponding DMA engine disables all of its bus accesses.

EARLY_RECV_INT.description: This bit indicates that the DMA filled the first data buffer of the packet. This bit is cleared when the software writes 1 to this bit or when Bit[6] (RI) of this register is set (whichever occurs earlier).

ABN_INT_SUMM.description: Abnormal Interrupt Summary bit value is the logical OR of the following when the corresponding interrupt bits are enabled in Interrupt Enable Register:   Bit[1]: Transmit Process Stopped.  Bit[3]: Transmit Jabber Timeout.  Bit[4]: Receive FIFO Overflow.  Bit[5]: Transmit Underflow.  Bit[7]: Receive Buffer Unavailable. Bit[8]: Receive Process Stopped.  Bit[9]: Receive Watchdog Timeout.  Bit[10]: Early Transmit Interrupt.  Bit[13]: Fatal Bus Error. Only unmasked bits affect the Abnormal Interrupt Summary bit. This is a sticky bit and must be cleared (by writing 1 to this bit) each time a corresponding bit which causes AIS to be set  is cleared.

NORM_INT_SUMM.description: Normal Interrupt Summary bit value is the logical OR of the following bits when the corresponding interrupt bits are enabled in Interrupt Enable Register:  Bit[0]: Transmit Interrupt.  Bit[2]: Transmit Buffer Unavailable.  Bit[6]: Receive Interrupt.  Bit[14]: Early Receive Interrupt. Only unmasked bits affect the Normal Interrupt Summary bit.This is a sticky bit and must be cleared (by writing 1 to this bit) each time a corresponding bit which causes NIS to be set  is cleared.

RECV_PROC_STATE.description: This field indicates the Receive DMA FSM state. This field does not generate an interrupt.  3'b000: Stopped. Reset or Stop Receive Command issued.  3'b001: Running. Fetching Receive Transfer Descriptor.  3'b010: Reserved for future use.  3'b011: Running. Waiting for RX packets.  3'b100: Suspended. Receive Descriptor Unavailable.  3'b101: Running. Closing Receive Descriptor.  3'b110: TIME_STAMP write state.  3'b111: Running. Transferring the TX packets data from receive buffer to host memory.

TRANS_PROC_STATE.description: This field indicates the Transmit DMA FSM state. This field does not generate an interrupt.  3'b000: Stopped. Reset or Stop Transmit Command issued.  3'b001: Running. Fetching Transmit Transfer Descriptor.  3'b010: Reserved for future use.  3'b011: Running. Waiting for TX packets.  3'b100: Suspended. Receive Descriptor Unavailable.  3'b101: Running. Closing Transmit Descriptor.  3'b110: TIME_STAMP write state.  3'b111: Running. Transferring the TX packets data from transmit buffer to host memory.

ERROR_BITS.description: This field indicates the type of error that caused a Bus Error  for example  error response on the AHB interface. This field is valid only when Bit[13] (FBI) is set. This field does not generate an interrupt.  3'b000: Error during Rx DMA Write Data Transfer.  3'b011: Error during Tx DMA Read Data Transfer.  3'b100: Error during Rx DMA Descriptor Write Access.  3'b101: Error during Tx DMA Descriptor Write Access.  3'b110: Error during Rx DMA Descriptor Read Access.  3'b111: Error during Tx DMA Descriptor Read Access.

PMT_INT.description: This bit indicates an interrupt event in the PMT module of the ETH_MAC. The software must read the PMT Control and Status Register in the MAC to get the exact cause of interrupt and clear its source to reset this bit to 1'b0.

TS_TRI_INT.description: This bit indicates an interrupt event in the Timestamp Generator block of the ETH_MAC.The software must read the corresponding registers in the ETH_MAC to get the exact cause of the interrupt and clear its source to reset this bit to 1'b0.

START_STOP_RX.description: When this bit is set  the Receive process is placed in the Running state. The DMA attempts to acquire the descriptor from the Receive list and processes the incoming frames.When this bit is cleared  the Rx DMA operation is stopped after the transfer of the current frame.

OPT_SECOND_FRAME.description: When this bit is set  it instructs the DMA to process the second frame of the Transmit data even before the status for the first frame is obtained.

RX_THRESH_CTRL.description: These two bits control the threshold level of the MTL Receive FIFO. Transfer (request) to DMA starts when the frame size within the MTL Receive FIFO is larger than the threshold. 2'b00: 64， 2'b01: 32， 2'b10: 96， 2'b11: 128 .

DROP_GFRM.description: When set  the MAC drops the received giant frames in the Rx FIFO  that is frames that are larger than the computed giant frame limit.

FWD_UNDER_GF.description: When set  the Rx FIFO forwards Undersized frames (that is  frames with no Error and length less than 64 bytes) including pad-bytes and CRC.

FWD_ERR_FRAME.description: When this bit is reset  the Rx FIFO drops frames with error status (CRC error collision error   giant frame  watchdog timeout  or overflow).

START_STOP_TRANSMISSION_COMMAND.description: When this bit is set  transmission is placed in the Running state  and the DMA checks the Transmit List at the current position for a frame to be transmitted.When this bit is reset  the transmission process is placed in the Stopped state after completing the transmission of the current frame.

TX_THRESH_CTRL.description: These bits control the threshold level of the MTL Transmit FIFO. Transmission starts when the frame size within the MTL Transmit FIFO is larger than the threshold. In addition  full frames with a length less than the threshold are also transmitted. These bits are used only when Tx_Str_fwd is reset. 3'b000: 64  3'b001: 128   3'b010: 192   3'b011: 256  3'b100: 40  3'b101: 32  3'b110: 24  3'b111: 16 .

FLUSH_TX_FIFO.description: When this bit is set  the transmit FIFO controller logic is reset to its default values  and thus all data in the Tx FIFO is lost or flushed. This bit is cleared internally when the flushing operation is complete.

TX_STR_FWD.description: When this bit is set  transmission starts when a full frame resides in the MTL Transmit FIFO. When this bit is set  the Tx_Thresh_Ctrl values specified in Tx_Thresh_Ctrl are ignored.

DIS_FLUSH_RECV_FRAMES.description: When this bit is set  the Rx DMA does not flush any frames because of the unavailability of receive descriptors or buffers.

RX_STORE_FORWARD.description: When this bit is set  the MTL reads a frame from the Rx FIFO only after the complete frame has been written to it.

DIS_DROP_TCPIP_ERR_FRAM.description: When this bit is set  the MAC does not drop the frames which only have errors detected by the Receive Checksum engine.When this bit is reset  all error frames are dropped if the Fwd_Err_Frame bit is reset.

DMAIN_TIE.description: When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[16])  the Transmit Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Transmit Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_TSE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Transmission Stopped Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Transmission Stopped Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_TBUE.description: When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 16)  the Transmit Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Transmit Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is Disabled.

DMAIN_TJTE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Transmit Jabber Timeout Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Transmit Jabber Timeout Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_OIE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Receive Overflow Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Overflow Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_UIE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Transmit Underflow Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Underflow Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_RIE.description: When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[16])  the Receive Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Receive Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_RBUE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Receive Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Receive Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_RSE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Receive Stopped Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Receive Stopped Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_RWTE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Receive Watchdog Timeout Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Receive Watchdog Timeout Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_ETIE.description: When this bit is set with an Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Early Transmit Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Early Transmit Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_FBEE.description: When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[15])  the Fatal Bus Error Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Fatal Bus Error Enable Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_ERIE.description: When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit[16])  the Early Receive Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset  the Early Receive Interrupt is disabled.

DMAIN_AISE.description: When this bit is set  abnormal interrupt summary is enabled. When this bit is reset the abnormal interrupt summary is disabled. This bit enables the following interrupts in Status Register:  Bit[1]: Transmit Process Stopped.  Bit[3]: Transmit Jabber Timeout.  Bit[4]: Receive Overflow.  Bit[5]: Transmit Underflow.  Bit[7]: Receive Buffer Unavailable.  Bit[8]: Receive Process Stopped.  Bit[9]: Receive Watchdog Timeout.  Bit[10]: Early Transmit Interrupt.  Bit[13]: Fatal Bus Error.

DMAIN_NISE.description: When this bit is set  normal interrupt summary is enabled. When this bit is reset  normal interrupt summary is disabled. This bit enables the following interrupts in Status Register:  Bit[0]: Transmit Interrupt.  Bit[2]: Transmit Buffer Unavailable.  Bit[6]: Receive Interrupt.  Bit[14]: Early Receive Interrupt.

MISSED_FC.description: This field indicates the number of frames missed by the controller because of the Host Receive Buffer being unavailable. This counter is incremented each time the DMA discards an incoming frame. The counter is cleared when this register is read.

OVERFLOW_BMFC.description: This bit is set every time Missed Frame Counter (Bits[15:0]) overflows that is  the DMA discards an incoming frame because of the Host Receive  Buffer being unavailable with the missed frame counter at maximum value. In such a scenario  the Missed frame counter is reset to all-zeros and this bit indicates that the rollover happened.

OVERFLOW_FC.description: This field indicates the number of frames missed by the application. This counter is incremented each time the MTL FIFO overflows. The counter is cleared when this register is read.

OVERFLOW_BFOC.description: This bit is set every time the Overflow Frame Counter (Bits[27:17]) overflows  that is  the Rx FIFO overflows with the overflow frame counter at maximum value. In such a scenario  the overflow frame counter is reset to all-zeros and this bit indicates that the rollover happened.

RIWTC.description: This bit indicates the number of system clock cycles multiplied by 256 for which the watchdog timer is set. The watchdog timer gets triggered with the programmed value after the Rx DMA completes the transfer of a frame for which the RI(RECV_INT) status bit is not set because of the setting in the corresponding descriptor RDES1[31]. When the watchdog timer runs out  the RI bit is set and the timer is stopped. The watchdog timer is reset when the RI bit is set high because of automatic setting of RI as per RDES1[31] of any received frame.

EX_OSCCLK_CONF.description: RMII clock half and whole divider settings

EX_CLK_CTRL.description: Clock enable and external/internal clock selection

START.description: Set this bit to start encryption operation on data buffer.

ADDRESS.description: The physical address on the off-chip flash must be 8-word boundary aligned.

DONE.description: Set this bit when encryption operation is complete.

FLASH_START.description: Set this bit to start encryption operation on data buffer.

ADDRESS.description: The physical address on the off-chip flash must be 8-word boundary aligned.

FLASH_DONE.description: Set this bit when encryption operation is complete.

SCL_LOW_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure the  low level width of SCL clock.

CTR.description: 1: normally ouput sda data   0: exchange the function of sda_o and sda_oe (sda_o is the original internal output sda signal sda_oe is the enable bit for the internal output sda signal)

SR.description: This register stores the value of ACK bit.

TO.description: This register is used to configure the max clock number of receiving  a data.

SLAVE_ADDR.description: when configured as i2c slave  this register is used to configure slave's address.

RXFIFO_ST.description: This is the offset address of the last receiving data as described in nonfifo_rx_thres_register.

FIFO_CONF.description: Config txfifo empty threhd value when using apb fifo access

DATA.description: The register represent the byte  data read from rxfifo when use apb fifo access

INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for rxfifo full when use apb fifo access.

INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rxfifo_full_int interrupt.

INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for rxfifo_full_int interrupt.

INT_STATUS.description: The masked interrupt status for rxfifo_full_int interrupt.

SDA_HOLD.description: This register is used to configure the clock num I2C used to hold the data after the negedge of SCL.

SDA_SAMPLE.description: This register is used to configure the clock num I2C used to sample data on SDA after the posedge of SCL

SCL_HIGH_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure the clock num during SCL is low level.

SCL_START_HOLD.description: This register is used to configure the clock num between the negedge of SDA and negedge of SCL for start mark.

SCL_RSTART_SETUP.description: This register is used to configure the clock num between the posedge of SCL and the negedge of SDA for restart mark.

SCL_STOP_HOLD.description: This register is used to configure the clock num after the STOP bit's posedge.

SCL_STOP_SETUP.description: This register is used to configure the clock num between the posedge of SCL and the posedge of SDA.

SCL_FILTER_CFG.description: When input SCL's pulse width is smaller than this register value  I2C ignores this pulse.

SDA_FILTER_CFG.description: When input SCL's pulse width is smaller than this register value  I2C ignores this pulse.

COMD%s.description: This is the content of command0. It consists of three part. op_code is the command  0: RSTART   1: WRITE  2: READ  3: STOP . 4:END.  Byte_num represent the number of data need to be send or data need to be received. ack_check_en  ack_exp and ack value are used to control  the ack bit.

SCL_LOW_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure the  low level width of SCL clock.

SDA_FORCE_OUT.description: 1: normally ouput sda data   0: exchange the function of sda_o and sda_oe (sda_o is the original internal output sda signal sda_oe is the enable bit for the internal output sda signal)

SCL_FORCE_OUT.description: 1: normally ouput scl clock  0: exchange the function of scl_o and scl_oe (scl_o is the original internal output scl signal  scl_oe is the enable bit for the internal output scl signal)

SAMPLE_SCL_LEVEL.description: Set this bit to sample data in SCL low level. clear this bit to sample data in SCL high level.

MS_MODE.description: Set this bit to configure the module as i2c master  clear this bit to configure the module as i2c slave.

TRANS_START.description: Set this bit to start sending data in txfifo.

TX_LSB_FIRST.description: This bit is used to control the sending mode for  data need to be send. 1: receive data from most significant bit    0: receive data from least significant bit

RX_LSB_FIRST.description: This bit is used to control the storage mode for received datas. 1: receive data from most significant bit    0: receive data from least significant bit

CLK_EN.description: This is the clock gating control bit for reading or writing registers.

ACK_REC.description: This register stores the value of ACK bit.

SLAVE_RW.description: when in slave mode  1: master read slave  0: master write slave.

TIME_OUT.description: when I2C takes more than time_out_reg clocks to receive a data then this register changes to high level.

ARB_LOST.description: when I2C lost control of SDA line  this register changes to high level.

BUS_BUSY.description: 1:I2C bus is busy transferring data. 0:I2C bus is in idle state.

SLAVE_ADDRESSED.description: when configured as i2c slave  and the address send by master is equal to slave's address  then this bit will be high level.

BYTE_TRANS.description: This register changes to high level when one byte is transferred.

RXFIFO_CNT.description: This register represent the amount of data need to send.

TXFIFO_CNT.description: This register stores the amount of received data  in ram.

SCL_MAIN_STATE_LAST.description: This register stores the value of state machine for i2c module.  3'h0: SCL_MAIN_IDLE  3'h1: SCL_ADDRESS_SHIFT 3'h2: SCL_ACK_ADDRESS  3'h3: SCL_RX_DATA  3'h4 SCL_TX_DATA  3'h5:SCL_SEND_ACK 3'h6:SCL_WAIT_ACK

SCL_STATE_LAST.description: This register stores the value of state machine to produce SCL. 3'h0: SCL_IDLE  3'h1:SCL_START   3'h2:SCL_LOW_EDGE  3'h3: SCL_LOW   3'h4:SCL_HIGH_EDGE   3'h5:SCL_HIGH  3'h6:SCL_STOP

TIME_OUT.description: This register is used to configure the max clock number of receiving  a data.

SLAVE_ADDR.description: when configured as i2c slave  this register is used to configure slave's address.

ADDR_10BIT_EN.description: This register is used to enable slave 10bit address mode.

RXFIFO_START_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the last receiving data as described in nonfifo_rx_thres_register.

RXFIFO_END_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the first receiving data as described in nonfifo_rx_thres_register.

TXFIFO_START_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the first  sending data as described in nonfifo_tx_thres register.

TXFIFO_END_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the last  sending data as described in nonfifo_tx_thres register.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_THRHD.description: Config txfifo empty threhd value when using apb fifo access

NONFIFO_EN.description: Set this bit to enble apb nonfifo access.

FIFO_ADDR_CFG_EN.description: When this bit is set to 1 then the byte after address represent the offset address of I2C Slave's ram.

RX_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset rx fifo when using apb fifo access.

TX_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset tx fifo when using apb fifo access.

NONFIFO_RX_THRES.description: when I2C receives more than nonfifo_rx_thres data  it will produce rx_send_full_int_raw interrupt and update the current offset address of the receiving data.

NONFIFO_TX_THRES.description: when I2C sends more than nonfifo_tx_thres data  it will produce tx_send_empty_int_raw interrupt and update the current offset address of the sending data.

FIFO_RDATA.description: The register represent the byte  data read from rxfifo when use apb fifo access

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for rxfifo full when use apb fifo access.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for txfifo empty when use apb fifo access.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for receiving data overflow when use apb fifo access.

END_DETECT_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for end_detect_int interrupt. when I2C deals with  the END command  it will produce end_detect_int interrupt.

SLAVE_TRAN_COMP_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for slave_tran_comp_int interrupt. when I2C Slave detectsthe STOP bit  it will produce slave_tran_comp_int interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for arbitration_lost_int interrupt.when I2C lost the usage right of I2C BUS it will produce arbitration_lost_int interrupt.

MASTER_TRAN_COMP_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for master_tra_comp_int interrupt. when I2C Master sends or receives a byte it will produce master_tran_comp_int interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for trans_complete_int interrupt. when I2C Master finished STOP command  it will produce trans_complete_int interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for time_out_int interrupt. when I2C takes a lot of time to receive a data  it will produce  time_out_int interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for trans_start_int interrupt. when I2C sends the START bit it will produce trans_start_int interrupt.

ACK_ERR_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for ack_err_int interrupt. when I2C receives a wrong ACK bit  it will produce ack_err_int interrupt..

RX_REC_FULL_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for rx_rec_full_int interrupt. when I2C receives more data  than nonfifo_rx_thres  it will produce rx_rec_full_int interrupt.

TX_SEND_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit for tx_send_empty_int interrupt.when I2C sends more data than nonfifo_tx_thres  it will produce tx_send_empty_int interrupt..

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rxfifo_full_int interrupt.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the txfifo_empty_int interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rxfifo_ovf_int interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the end_detect_int interrupt.

SLAVE_TRAN_COMP_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the slave_tran_comp_int interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the arbitration_lost_int interrupt.

MASTER_TRAN_COMP_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the master_tran_comp interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the trans_complete_int interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the time_out_int interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the trans_start_int interrupt.

ACK_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the ack_err_int interrupt.

RX_REC_FULL_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rx_rec_full_int interrupt.

TX_SEND_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the tx_send_empty_int interrupt.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for rxfifo_full_int interrupt.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for txfifo_empty_int interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for rxfifo_ovf_int interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for end_detect_int interrupt.

SLAVE_TRAN_COMP_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for slave_tran_comp_int interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for arbitration_lost_int interrupt.

MASTER_TRAN_COMP_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for master_tran_comp_int interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for trans_complete_int interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for time_out_int interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for trans_start_int interrupt.

ACK_ERR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for ack_err_int interrupt.

RX_REC_FULL_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for rx_rec_full_int interrupt.

TX_SEND_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for tx_send_empty_int interrupt.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for rxfifo_full_int interrupt.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for txfifo_empty_int interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for rxfifo_ovf_int interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for end_detect_int interrupt.

SLAVE_TRAN_COMP_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for slave_tran_comp_int interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for arbitration_lost_int interrupt.

MASTER_TRAN_COMP_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for master_tran_comp_int interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for trans_complete_int interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for time_out_int interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for trans_start_int interrupt.

ACK_ERR_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status for ack_err_int interrupt.

TIME.description: This register is used to configure the clock num I2C used to hold the data after the negedge of SCL.
This register is used to configure the clock num I2C used to sample data on SDA after the posedge of SCL

SCL_HIGH_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure the clock num during SCL is low level.

TIME.description: This register is used to configure the clock num between the negedge of SDA and negedge of SCL for start mark.
This register is used to configure the clock num between the posedge of SCL and the negedge of SDA for restart mark.
This register is used to configure the clock num after the STOP bit's posedge.
This register is used to configure the clock num between the posedge of SCL and the posedge of SDA.

SCL_FILTER_THRES.description: When input SCL's pulse width is smaller than this register value  I2C ignores this pulse.

SCL_FILTER_EN.description: This is the filter enable bit for SCL.

SDA_FILTER_THRES.description: When input SCL's pulse width is smaller than this register value  I2C ignores this pulse.

SDA_FILTER_EN.description: This is the filter enable bit for SDA.

COMMAND.description: This is the content of command0. It consists of three part. op_code is the command  0: RSTART   1: WRITE  2: READ  3: STOP . 4:END.  Byte_num represent the number of data need to be send or data need to be received. ack_check_en  ack_exp and ack value are used to control  the ack bit.

COMMAND_DONE.description: When command0 is done in I2C Master mode  this bit changes to high level.

PIN_CTRL.description: If you want to output clock for I2S0 to: CLK_OUT1, then set PIN_CTRL[3:0] = 0x0; CLK_OUT2, then set PIN_CTRL[3:0] = 0x0 and PIN_CTRL[7:4] = 0x0; CLK_OUT3, then set PIN_CTRL[3:0] = 0x0 and PIN_CTRL[11:8] = 0x0. If you want to output clock for I2S1 to: CLK_OUT1, then set PIN_CTRL[3:0] = 0xF; CLK_OUT2, then set PIN_CTRL[3:0] = 0xF and PIN_CTRL[7:4] = 0x0; CLK_OUT3, then set PIN_CTRL[3:0] = 0xF and PIN_CTRL[11:8] = 0x0.

MCU_OE.description: Output enable of the pad in sleep mode. 1: enable output; 0: disable output.

SLP_SEL.description: Sleep mode selection of this pad. Set to 1 to put the pad in sleep mode.

MCU_WPD.description: Pull-down enable of the pad during sleep mode. 1: internal pull-down enabled; 0: internal pull-down disabled.

MCU_WPU.description: Pull-up enable of the pad during sleep mode. 1: internal pull-up enabled; 0: internal pull-up disabled.

MCU_IE.description: Input enable of the pad during sleep mode. 1: input enabled; 0: input disabled.

MCU_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad during sleep mode. A higher value corresponds with a higher strength.

FUN_WPD.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled, 0: internal pull-down disabled. GPIO pins 34-39 are input-only. These pins do not feature an output driver or internal pull- up/pull-down circuitry, therefore, their FUN_WPD is always 0.

FUN_WPU.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled; 0: internal pull-up disabled. GPIO pins 34-39 are input-only. These pins do not feature an output driver or internal pull- up/pull- down circuitry, therefore, their FUN_WPU is always 0.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable of the pad. 1: input enabled; 0: input disabled.

FUN_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. A higher value corresponds with a higher strength. For GPIO34-39, FUN_DRV is always 0. For detailed drive strength, please see note 8 in Table ”Notes on ESP32 Pin Lists”, in ESP32 Datasheet.

MCU_SEL.description: Select the IO_MUX function for this signal. 0 selects Function 0, 1 selects Function 1, etc.

MCU_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad during sleep mode. A higher value corresponds with a higher strength.

FUN_WPD.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled, 0: internal pull-down disabled. GPIO pins 34-39 are input-only. These pins do not feature an output driver or internal pull- up/pull-down circuitry, therefore, their FUN_WPD is always 0.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable of the pad. 1: input enabled; 0: input disabled.

FUN_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. A higher value corresponds with a higher strength. For GPIO34-39, FUN_DRV is always 0. For detailed drive strength, please see note 8 in Table ”Notes on ESP32 Pin Lists”, in ESP32 Datasheet.

HSCH%s_CONF0.description: There are four high speed timers  the two bits are used to select one of them for high speed channel0.  2'b00: seletc hstimer0.   2'b01: select hstimer1.  2'b10: select hstimer2.    2'b11: select hstimer3.

HSCH%s_HPOINT.description: The output value changes to high when htimerx(x=[0 3]) selected by high speed channel0 has reached reg_hpoint_hsch0[19:0]

HSCH%s_DUTY.description: This register represents the current duty of the output signal for high speed channel0.

HSCH%s_CONF1.description: This register controls the increase or decrease step scale for high speed channel0.

HSCH%s_DUTY_R.description: This register represents the current duty cycle of the output signal for high-speed channel %s

LSCH%s_CONF0.description: There are four low speed timers  the two bits are used to select one of them for low speed channel0.  2'b00: seletc lstimer0.   2'b01: select lstimer1.  2'b10: select lstimer2.    2'b11: select lstimer3.

LSCH%s_HPOINT.description: The output value changes to high when lstimerx(x=[0 3]) selected by low speed channel0 has reached reg_hpoint_lsch0[19:0]

LSCH%s_DUTY.description: This register represents the current duty of the output signal for low speed channel0.

LSCH%s_CONF1.description: This register controls the increase or decrease step scale for low speed channel0.

LSCH%s_DUTY_R.description: This register represents the current duty cycle of the output signal for low-speed channel %s

HSTIMER%s_CONF.description: This register controls the range of the counter in high speed timer0. the counter range is [0 2**reg_hstimer0_lim] the max bit width for counter is 20.

HSTIMER%s_VALUE.description: software can read this register to get the current counter value in high speed timer0

LSTIMER%s_CONF.description: This register controls the range of the counter in low speed timer0. the counter range is [0 2**reg_lstimer0_lim] the max bit width for counter is 20.

LSTIMER%s_VALUE.description: software can read this register to get the current counter value in low speed timer0.

INT_RAW.description: The interrupt raw bit for high speed channel0  counter overflow.

INT_ST.description: The interrupt status bit for high speed channel0  counter overflow event.

INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for high speed channel0  counter overflow interrupt.

INT_CLR.description: Set this  bit to clear  high speed channel0  counter overflow interrupt.

CONF.description: This bit is used to set the frequency of slow_clk. 1'b1:80mhz  1'b0:8mhz

TIMER_SEL.description: There are four high speed timers  the two bits are used to select one of them for high speed channel0.  2'b00: seletc hstimer0.   2'b01: select hstimer1.  2'b10: select hstimer2.    2'b11: select hstimer3.

SIG_OUT_EN.description: This is the output enable control bit for high speed channel0

IDLE_LV.description: This bit is used to control the output value when high speed channel0 is off.

HPOINT.description: The output value changes to high when htimerx(x=[0 3]) selected by high speed channel0 has reached reg_hpoint_hsch0[19:0]

DUTY.description: This register represents the current duty of the output signal for high speed channel0.

DUTY_SCALE.description: This register controls the increase or decrease step scale for high speed channel0.

DUTY_CYCLE.description: This register is used to increase or decrease the duty every reg_duty_cycle_hsch0 cycles for high speed channel0.

DUTY_NUM.description: This register is used to control the num of increased or decreased times for high speed channel0.

DUTY_INC.description: This register is used to increase the duty of output signal or decrease the duty of output signal for high speed channel0.

DUTY_START.description: When reg_duty_num_hsch0 reg_duty_cycle_hsch0 and reg_duty_scale_hsch0 has been configured. these register won't take effect until set reg_duty_start_hsch0. this bit is automatically cleared by hardware.

DUTY_R.description: This register represents the current duty cycle of the output signal for high-speed channel %s

TIMER_SEL.description: There are four low speed timers  the two bits are used to select one of them for low speed channel0.  2'b00: seletc lstimer0.   2'b01: select lstimer1.  2'b10: select lstimer2.    2'b11: select lstimer3.

SIG_OUT_EN.description: This is the output enable control bit for low speed channel0.

IDLE_LV.description: This bit is used to control the output value when low speed channel0 is off.

PARA_UP.description: This bit is used to update register LEDC_LSCH0_HPOINT and LEDC_LSCH0_DUTY for low speed channel0.

HPOINT.description: The output value changes to high when lstimerx(x=[0 3]) selected by low speed channel0 has reached reg_hpoint_lsch0[19:0]

DUTY.description: This register represents the current duty of the output signal for low speed channel0.

DUTY_SCALE.description: This register controls the increase or decrease step scale for low speed channel0.

DUTY_CYCLE.description: This register is used to increase or decrease the duty every reg_duty_cycle_lsch0 cycles for low speed channel0.

DUTY_NUM.description: This register is used to control the num of increased or decreased times for low speed channel6.

DUTY_INC.description: This register is used to increase the duty of output signal or decrease the duty of output signal for low speed channel6.

DUTY_START.description: When reg_duty_num_hsch1 reg_duty_cycle_hsch1 and reg_duty_scale_hsch1 has been configured. these register won't take effect until set reg_duty_start_hsch1. this bit is automatically cleared by hardware.

DUTY_R.description: This register represents the current duty cycle of the output signal for low-speed channel %s

DUTY_RES.description: This register controls the range of the counter in high speed timer0. the counter range is [0 2**reg_hstimer0_lim] the max bit width for counter is 20.

DIV_NUM.description: This register is used to configure parameter for divider in high speed timer0 the least significant eight bits represent the decimal part.

PAUSE.description: This bit is used to pause the counter in high speed timer0

RST.description: This bit is used to reset high speed timer0 the counter will be 0 after reset.

TICK_SEL.description: This bit is used to choose apb_clk or ref_tick for high speed timer0. 1'b1:apb_clk  0:ref_tick

CNT.description: software can read this register to get the current counter value in high speed timer0

DUTY_RES.description: This register controls the range of the counter in low speed timer0. the counter range is [0 2**reg_lstimer0_lim] the max bit width for counter is 20.

DIV_NUM.description: This register is used to configure parameter for divider in low speed timer0 the least significant eight bits represent the decimal part.

PAUSE.description: This bit is used to pause the counter in low speed timer0.

RST.description: This bit is used to reset low speed timer0 the counter will be 0 after reset.

TICK_SEL.description: This bit is used to choose slow_clk or ref_tick for low speed timer0. 1'b1:slow_clk  0:ref_tick

PARA_UP.description: Set this bit  to update  reg_div_num_lstime0 and  reg_lstimer0_lim.

CNT.description: software can read this register to get the current counter value in low speed timer0.

CH%sCONF0.description: This register is used to configure the  frequency divider's factor in channel0.

CH%sADDR.description: The ram relative address in channel0 by apb fifo access

INT_RAW.description: The interrupt raw bit for channel %s turns to high level when the transmit process is done.

INT_ST.description: The interrupt  state bit for channel %s's mt_ch%s_tx_end_int_raw when mt_ch%s_tx_end_int_ena is set to %s.

INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to enable rmt_ch%s_tx_end_int_st.

INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rmt_ch%s_rx_end_int_raw..

CH%sCARRIER_DUTY.description: This register is used to configure carrier wave's low level value for channel0.

CH%s_TX_LIM.description: When channel0 sends more than reg_rmt_tx_lim_ch0 datas then channel0 produce the relative interrupt.

APB_CONF.description: Set this bit to disable apb fifo access

DIV_CNT.description: This register is used to configure the  frequency divider's factor in channel0.

IDLE_THRES.description: In receive mode when no edge is detected on the input signal for longer than reg_idle_thres_ch0 then the receive process is done.

MEM_SIZE.description: This register is used to configure the the amount of memory blocks allocated to channel0.

CARRIER_EN.description: This is the carrier modulation enable control bit for channel0.

CARRIER_OUT_LV.description: This bit is used to configure the way carrier wave is modulated for  channel0.1'b1:transmit on low output level  1'b0:transmit  on high output level.

MEM_PD.description: This bit is used to reduce power consumed by mem. 1:mem is in low power state.

CLK_EN.description: This bit  is used  to control clock.when software config RMT internal registers  it controls the register clock.

TX_START.description: Set this bit to start sending data for channel0.

RX_EN.description: Set this bit to enbale receving data for channel0.

MEM_WR_RST.description: Set this bit to reset write ram address for channel0 by receiver access.

MEM_RD_RST.description: Set this bit to reset read ram address for channel0 by transmitter access.

APB_MEM_RST.description: Set this bit to reset W/R ram address for channel0 by apb fifo access

MEM_OWNER.description: This is the mark of channel0's ram usage right.1'b1：receiver uses the ram  0：transmitter uses the ram

TX_CONTI_MODE.description: Set this bit to continue sending  from the first data to the last data in channel0 again and again.

RX_FILTER_EN.description: This is the receive filter enable bit for channel0.

RX_FILTER_THRES.description: in receive mode  channel0 ignore input pulse when the pulse width is smaller then this value.

REF_CNT_RST.description: This bit is used to reset divider in channel0.

REF_ALWAYS_ON.description: This bit is used to select base clock. 1'b1:clk_apb  1'b0:clk_ref

IDLE_OUT_LV.description: This bit configures the output signal's level for channel0 in IDLE state.

IDLE_OUT_EN.description: This is the output enable control bit for channel0 in IDLE state.

MEM_WADDR_EX.description: The current memory read address of channel0.

MEM_RADDR_EX.description: The current memory write address of channel0.

STATE.description: The channel0 state machine status register.3'h0 : idle, 3'h1 : send, 3'h2 : read memory, 3'h3 : receive, 3'h4 : wait.

MEM_OWNER_ERR.description: When channel0 is configured for receive mode, this bit will turn to high level if rmt_mem_owner register is not set to 1.

MEM_FULL.description: The memory full status bit for channel0 turns to high level when mem_waddr_ex is greater than or equal to the configuration range.

MEM_EMPTY.description: The memory empty status bit for channel0. in acyclic mode, this bit turns to high level when mem_raddr_ex is greater than or equal to the configured range.

APB_MEM_WR_ERR.description: The apb write memory status bit for channel0 turns to high level when the apb write address exceeds the configuration range.

APB_MEM_RD_ERR.description: The apb read memory status bit for channel0 turns to high level when the apb read address exceeds the configuration range.

APB_MEM_ADDR.description: The ram relative address in channel0 by apb fifo access

CH%s_TX_END.description: The interrupt raw bit for channel %s turns to high level when the transmit process is done.

CH%s_RX_END.description: The interrupt raw bit for channel %s turns to high level when the receive process is done.

CH%s_ERR.description: The interrupt raw bit for channel %s turns to high level when channle %s detects some errors.

CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT.description: The interrupt raw bit for channel %s turns to high level when transmitter in channle%s  have send datas more than  reg_rmt_tx_lim_ch%s  after detecting this interrupt  software can updata the old datas with new datas.

CH%s_TX_END.description: The interrupt  state bit for channel %s's mt_ch%s_tx_end_int_raw when mt_ch%s_tx_end_int_ena is set to %s.

CH%s_RX_END.description: The interrupt  state bit for channel %s's rmt_ch%s_rx_end_int_raw when  rmt_ch%s_rx_end_int_ena is set to %s.

CH%s_ERR.description: The interrupt  state bit for channel %s's rmt_ch%s_err_int_raw when  rmt_ch%s_err_int_ena is set to %s.

CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT.description: The interrupt state bit  for channel %s's rmt_ch%s_tx_thr_event_int_raw when mt_ch%s_tx_thr_event_int_ena is set to 1.

CONTROLLER_RESET.description: To reset controller, firmware should set this bit. This bit is auto-cleared after two AHB and two sdhost_cclk_in clock cycles.

FIFO_RESET.description:
To reset FIFO, firmware should set bit to 1. This bit is auto-cleared after completion of reset operation.
Note: FIFO pointers will be out of reset after 2 cycles of system clocks in addition to synchronization delay (2 cycles of card clock), after the fifo_reset is cleared.

DMA_RESET.description: To reset DMA interface, firmware should set bit to 1. This bit is auto-cleared after two AHB clocks.

INT_ENABLE.description: Global interrupt enable/disable bit. 0: Disable; 1: Enable.

READ_WAIT.description: For sending read-wait to SDIO cards.

SEND_IRQ_RESPONSE.description: Bit automatically clears once response is sent. To wait for MMC card interrupts, host issues CMD40 and waits for interrupt response from MMC card(s). In the meantime, if host wants SD/MMC to exit waiting for interrupt state, it can set this bit, at which time SD/MMC command state-machine sends CMD40 response on bus and returns to idle state.

ABORT_READ_DATA.description: After a suspend-command is issued during a read-operation, software polls the card to find when the suspend-event occurred. Once the suspend-event has occurred, software sets the bit which will reset the data state machine that is waiting for the next block of data. This bit is automatically cleared once the data state machine is reset to idle.

SEND_CCSD.description:
When set, SD/MMC sends CCSD to the CE-ATA device. Software sets this bit only if the current command is expecting CCS (that is, RW_BLK), and if interrupts are enabled for the CE-ATA device. Once the CCSD pattern is sent to the device, SD/MMC automatically clears the SDHOST_SEND_CCSD bit. It also sets the Command Done (CD) bit  in the SDHOST_RINTSTS_REG register, and generates an interrupt for the host, in case the Command Done interrupt is not masked. 
NOTE: Once the SDHOST_SEND_CCSD bit is set, it takes two card clock cycles to drive the CCSD on the CMD line. Due to this, within the boundary conditions the CCSD may be sent to the CE-ATA device, even if the device has signalled CCS.

SEND_AUTO_STOP_CCSD.description: Always Set SDHOST_SEND_AUTO_STOP_CCSD and SDHOST_SEND_CCSD bits together; SDHOST_SEND_AUTO_STOP_CCSD should not be set independently of send_ccsd. When set, SD/MMC automatically sends an internally-generated STOP command (CMD12) to the CE-ATA device. After sending this internally-generated STOP command, the Auto Command Done (ACD) bit in SDHOST_RINTSTS_REG is set and an interrupt is generated for the host, in case the ACD interrupt is not masked. After sending the Command Completion Signal Disable (CCSD), SD/MMC automatically clears the  SDHOST_SEND_AUTO_STOP_CCSD bit.

CEATA_DEVICE_INTERRUPT_STATUS.description: Software should appropriately write to this bit after the power-on reset or any other reset to the CE-ATA device. After reset, the CE-ATA device's interrupt is usually disabled (nIEN = 1). If the host enables the CE-ATA device's interrupt, then software should set this bit.

CLK_DIVIDER0.description: Clock divider0 value. Clock divisor is 2*n, where n = 0 bypasses the divider (divisor of 1). For example, a value of 1 means divided by 2*1 = 2, a value of 0xFF means divided by 2*255 = 510, and so on.

CLK_DIVIDER1.description: Clock divider1 value. Clock divisor is 2*n, where n = 0 bypasses the divider (divisor of 1). For example, a value of 1 means divided by 2*1 = 2, a value of 0xFF means divided by 2*255 = 510, and so on.

CLK_DIVIDER2.description: Clock divider2 value. Clock divisor is 2*n, where n = 0 bypasses the divider (divisor of 1). For example, a value of 1 means divided by 2*1 = 2, a value of 0xFF means divided by 2*255 = 510, and so on.

CLK_DIVIDER3.description: Clock divider3 value. Clock divisor is 2*n, where n = 0 bypasses the divider (divisor of 1). For example, a value of 1 means divided by 2*1 = 2, a value of 0xFF means divided by 2*255 = 510, and so on.

RESPONSE_TIMEOUT.description: Response timeout value. Value is specified in terms of number of card output clocks, i.e., sdhost_cclk_out.

DATA_TIMEOUT.description:
Value for card data read timeout. This value is also used for data starvation by host timeout. The timeout counter is started only after the card clock is stopped. This value is specified in number of card output clocks, i.e. sdhost_cclk_out of the selected card.
NOTE: The software timer should be used if the timeout value is in the order of 100 ms. In this case, read data timeout interrupt needs to be disabled.

CARD_WIDTH4.description:
One bit per card indicates if card is 1-bit or 4-bit mode.
0: 1-bit mode;
1: 4-bit mode.
Bit[1:0] correspond to card[1:0] respectively.

CARD_WIDTH8.description:
One bit per card indicates if card is in 8-bit mode.
0: Non 8-bit mode;
1: 8-bit mode.
Bit[17:16] correspond to card[1:0] respectively.

BYTE_COUNT.description: Number of bytes to be transferred, should be an integral multiple of Block Size for block transfers. For data transfers of undefined byte lengths, byte count should be set to 0. When byte count is set to 0, it is the responsibility of host to explicitly send stop/abort command to terminate data transfer.

SDIO_INT_MASK.description: SDIO interrupt mask, one bit for each card. Bit[17:16] correspond to card[15:0] respectively. When masked, SDIO interrupt detection for that card is disabled. 0 masks an interrupt, and 1 enables an interrupt.

CMDARG.description: Value indicates command argument to be passed to the card.

RESPONSE_EXPECT.description: 0: No response expected from card; 1: Response expected from card.

RESPONSE_LENGTH.description: 0: Short response expected from card; 1: Long response expected from card.

CHECK_RESPONSE_CRC.description:
0: Do not check; 1: Check response CRC.
Some of command responses do not return valid CRC bits. Software should disable CRC checks for those commands in order to disable CRC checking by controller.

DATA_EXPECTED.description: 0: No data transfer expected; 1: Data transfer expected.

READ_WRITE.description:
0: Read from card; 1: Write to card.
Don't care if no data is expected from card.

TRANSFER_MODE.description:
Block data transfer command; 1: Stream data transfer command.
Don't care if no data expected.

SEND_AUTO_STOP.description: 0: No stop command is sent at the end of data transfer; 1: Send stop command at the end of data transfer.

WAIT_PRVDATA_COMPLETE.description:
0: Send command at once, even if previous data transfer has not completed; 1: Wait for previous data transfer to complete before sending Command.
The SDHOST_WAIT_PRVDATA_COMPLETE] = 0 option is typically used to query status of card during data transfer or to stop current data transfer. SDHOST_CARD_NUMBERr should be same as in previous command.

STOP_ABORT_CMD.description:
0: Neither stop nor abort command can stop current data transfer. If abort is sent to function-number currently selected or not in data-transfer mode, then bit should be set to 0; 1: Stop or abort command intended to stop current data transfer in progress.
When open-ended or predefined data transfer is in progress, and host issues stop or abort command to stop data transfer, bit should be set so that command/data state-machines of CIU can return correctly to idle state.

SEND_INITIALIZATION.description:
0: Do not send initialization sequence (80 clocks of 1) before sending this command; 1: Send initialization sequence before sending this command.
After powered on, 80 clocks must be sent to card for initialization before sending any commands to card. Bit should be set while sending first command to card so that controller will initialize clocks before sending command to card.

CARD_NUMBER.description: Card number in use. Represents physical slot number of card being accessed. In SD-only mode, up to two cards are supported.

UPDATE_CLOCK_REGISTERS_ONLY.description:
0: Normal command sequence; 1: Do not send commands, just update clock register value into card clock domain.
Following register values are transferred into card clock domain: CLKDIV, CLRSRC, and CLKENA.
Changes card clocks (change frequency, truncate off or on, and set low-frequency mode). This is provided in order to change clock frequency or stop clock without having to send command to cards. During normal command sequence, when sdhost_update_clock_registers_only = 0, following control registers are transferred from BIU to CIU: CMD, CMDARG, TMOUT, CTYPE, BLKSIZ, and BYTCNT. CIU uses new register values for new command sequence to card(s). When bit is set, there are no Command Done interrupts because no command is sent to SD_MMC_CEATA cards.

READ_CEATA_DEVICE.description:
Read access flag.
0: Host is not performing read access (RW_REG or RW_BLK)towards CE-ATA device;
1: Host is performing read access (RW_REG or RW_BLK) towards CE-ATA device.
Software should set this bit to indicate that CE-ATA device is being accessed for read transfer. This bit is used to disable read data timeout indication while performing CE-ATA read transfers. Maximum value of I/O transmission delay can be no less than 10 seconds. SD/MMC should not indicate read data timeout while waiting for data from CE-ATA device.

CCS_EXPECTED.description:
Expected Command Completion Signal (CCS) configuration.
0: Interrupts are not enabled in CE-ATA device (nIEN = 1 in ATA control register), or command does not expect CCS from device;
1: Interrupts are enabled in CE-ATA device (nIEN = 0), and RW_BLK command expects command completion signal from CE-ATA device. 
If the command expects Command Completion Signal (CCS) from the CE-ATA device, the software should set this control bit. SD/MMC sets Data Transfer Over (DTO) bit in RINTSTS register and generates interrupt to host if Data Transfer Over interrupt is not masked.

START_CMD.description: Start command. Once command is served by the CIU, this bit is automatically cleared. When this bit is set, host should not attempt to write to any command registers. If a write is attempted, hardware lock error is set in raw interrupt register. Once command is sent and a response is received from SD_MMC_CEATA cards, Command Done bit is set in the raw interrupt Register.

SDIO_INTERRUPT_MSK.description: Interrupt from SDIO card, one bit for each card. Bit[17:16] correspond to card1 and card0, respectively. SDIO interrupt for card is enabled only if corresponding sdhost_sdio_int_mask bit is set in Interrupt mask register (Setting mask bit enables interrupt).

FIFO_RX_WATERMARK.description: FIFO reached Receive watermark level, not qualified with data transfer.

FIFO_TX_WATERMARK.description: FIFO reached Transmit watermark level, not qualified with data transfer.

DATA_STATE_MC_BUSY.description: Data transmit or receive state-machine is busy.

RESPONSE_INDEX.description: Index of previous response, including any auto-stop sent by core.

FIFO_COUNT.description: FIFO count, number of filled locations in FIFO.

TX_WMARK.description: FIFO threshold watermark level when transmitting data to card. When FIFO data count is less than or equal to this number, DMA/FIFO request is raised. If Interrupt is enabled, then interrupt  occurs. During end of packet, request or interrupt is generated, regardless of threshold programming.In non-DMA mode, when transmit FIFO threshold (TXDR) interrupt is enabled, then interrupt is generated instead of DMA request. During end of packet, on last interrupt, host is responsible for filling FIFO with only required remaining bytes (not before FIFO is full or after CIU completes data transfers, because FIFO may not be empty).  In DMA mode, at end of packet, if last transfer is less than burst  size, DMA controller does single cycles until required bytes are  transferred.

RX_WMARK.description: FIFO threshold watermark level when receiving data to card.When FIFO data count reaches greater than this number , DMA/FIFO request is raised. During end of packet, request is generated regardless of threshold programming in order to complete any remaining data.In non-DMA mode, when receiver FIFO threshold (RXDR) interrupt is enabled, then interrupt is generated instead of DMA request.During end of packet, interrupt is not generated if threshold programming is larger than any remaining data. It is responsibility of host to read remaining bytes on seeing Data Transfer Done interrupt.In DMA mode, at end of packet, even if remaining bytes are less than threshold, DMA request does single transfers to flush out any remaining bytes before Data Transfer Done interrupt is set.

CARD_DETECT_N.description: Value on sdhost_card_detect_n input ports (1 bit per card), read-only bits. 0 represents presence of card. Only NUM_CARDS number of bits are implemented.

WRITE_PROTECT.description: Value on sdhost_card_write_prt input ports (1 bit per card). 1 represents write protection. Only NUM_CARDS number of bits are implemented.

TCBCNT.description: Number of bytes transferred by CIU unit to card.

TBBCNT.description: Number of bytes transferred between Host/DMA memory and BIU FIFO.

DEBOUNCE_COUNT.description: Number of host clocks (clk) used by debounce filter logic. The typical debounce time is 5 \verb+~+ 25 ms to prevent the card instability when the card is inserted or removed.

USRID.description: User identification register, value set by user. Can also be used as a scratchpad register by user.

VERSIONID.description: Hardware version register. Can also be read by fireware.

HOLD.description: Have a hold regiser in data path .

DDR.description:
DDR mode selecton,1 bit for each card.
0-Non-DDR mdoe.
1-DDR mdoe.

CARD_RESET.description:
Hardware reset.
1: Active mode; 
0: Reset. 
These bits cause the cards to enter pre-idle state, which requires them to be re-initialized. SDHOST_RST_CARD_RESET[0] should be set to 1'b0 to reset card0, SDHOST_RST_CARD_RESET[1] should be set to 1'b0 to reset card1.

SWR.description: Software Reset. When set, the DMA Controller resets all its internal registers. It is automatically cleared after one clock cycle.

FB.description: Fixed Burst. Controls whether the AHB Master interface performs fixed burst transfers or not. When set, the AHB will use only SINGLE, INCR4, INCR8 or INCR16 during start of normal burst transfers. When reset, the AHB will use SINGLE and INCR burst transfer operations.

DE.description: IDMAC Enable. When set, the IDMAC is enabled.

PD.description: Poll Demand. If the OWNER bit of a descriptor is not set, the FSM goes to the Suspend state. The host needs to write any value into this register for the IDMAC FSM to resume normal descriptor fetch operation. This is a write only .

DBADDR.description: Start of Descriptor List. Contains the base address of the First Descriptor. The LSB bits [1:0] are ignored and taken as all-zero by the IDMAC internally. Hence these LSB bits may be treated as read-only.

TI.description: Transmit Interrupt. Indicates that data transmission is finished for a descriptor. Writing 1 clears this bit.

RI.description: Receive Interrupt. Indicates the completion of data reception for a descriptor. Writing 1 clears this bit.

FBE.description: Fatal Bus Error Interrupt. Indicates that a Bus Error occurred (IDSTS[12:10]) . When this bit is set, the DMA disables all its bus accesses. Writing 1 clears this bit.

DU.description: Descriptor Unavailable Interrupt. This bit is set when the descriptor is unavailable due to OWNER bit = 0 (DES0[31] = 0). Writing 1 clears this bit.

NIS.description: Normal Interrupt Summary. Logical OR of the following: IDSTS[0] : Transmit Interrupt, IDSTS[1] : Receive Interrupt. Only unmasked bits affect this bit. This is a sticky bit and must be cleared each time a corresponding bit that causes NIS to be set is cleared. Writing 1 clears this bit.

AIS.description: Abnormal Interrupt Summary. Logical OR of the following: IDSTS[2] : Fatal Bus Interrupt, IDSTS[4] : DU bit Interrupt. Only unmasked bits affect this bit. This is a sticky bit and must be cleared each time a corresponding bit that causes AIS to be set is cleared. Writing 1 clears this bit.

TI.description: Transmit Interrupt Enable. When set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable, Transmit Interrupt is enabled. When reset, Transmit Interrupt is disabled.

RI.description: Receive Interrupt Enable. When set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable, Receive Interrupt is enabled. When reset, Receive Interrupt is disabled.

FBE.description: Fatal Bus Error Enable. When set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable, the Fatal Bus Error Interrupt is enabled. When reset, Fatal Bus Error Enable Interrupt is disabled.

DU.description: Descriptor Unavailable Interrupt. When set along with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable, the DU interrupt is enabled.

CES.description: Card Error summary Interrupt Enable. When set, it enables the Card Interrupt summary.

DSCADDR.description: Host Descriptor Address Pointer, updated by IDMAC during operation and cleared on reset. This register points to the start address of the current descriptor read by the IDMAC.

BUFADDR.description: Host Buffer Address Pointer, updated by IDMAC during operation and cleared on reset. This register points to the current Data Buffer Address being accessed by the IDMAC.

CARDRDTHREN.description:
Card read threshold enable.
1'b0-Card read threshold disabled.
1'b1-Card read threshold enabled.

CARDCLRINTEN.description:
Busy clear interrupt generation:
1'b0-Busy clear interrypt disabled.
1'b1-Busy clear interrypt enabled.

CARDWRTHREN.description:
Applicable when HS400 mode is enabled.
1'b0-Card write Threshold disabled.
1'b1-Card write Threshold enabled.

CARDTHRESHOLD.description: The inside FIFO size is 512,This register is applicable when SDHOST_CARDERTHREN_REG is set to 1 or SDHOST_CARDRDTHREN_REG set to 1.

HALFSTARTBIT.description:
Control for start bit detection mechanism duration of start bit.Each bit refers to one slot.Set this bit to 1 for eMMC4.5 and above,set to 0 for SD applications.For eMMC4.5,start bit can be:
1'b0-Full cycle.
1'b1-less than one full cycle.

ENABLE_SHIFT.description:
Control for the amount of phase shift provided on the default enables in the design.Two bits assigned for each card.
2'b00-Default phase shift.
2'b01-Enables shifted to next immediate positive edge.
2'b10-Enables shifted to next immediate negative edge.
2'b11-Reserved.

BUFFIFO.description: CPU write and read transmit data by FIFO. This register points to the current Data FIFO .

CCLKIN_EDGE_DRV_SEL.description: It's used to select the clock phase of the output signal from phase 0, phase 90, phase 180, phase 270.

CCLKIN_EDGE_SAM_SEL.description: It's used to select the clock phase of the input signal from phase 0, phase 90, phase 180, phase 270.

CCLKIN_EDGE_SLF_SEL.description: It's used to select the clock phase of the internal signal from phase 0, phase 90, phase 180, phase 270.

CCLLKIN_EDGE_H.description: The high level of the divider clock. The value should be smaller than CCLKIN_EDGE_L.

CCLLKIN_EDGE_L.description: The low level of the divider clock. The value should be  larger than CCLKIN_EDGE_H.

CCLLKIN_EDGE_N.description: The value should be equal to CCLKIN_EDGE_L.

SAR_I2C_CTRL.description: I2C control data  only active when reg_sar_i2c_start_force = 1

SAR_TOUCH_CTRL2.description: 10-bit register to indicate which pads are "touched"

SAR_TOUCH_ENABLE.description: Bitmap defining the working set during the measurement.

SAR_DAC_CTRL1.description: frequency step for CW generator  can be used to adjust the frequency

SAR_DAC_CTRL2.description: DC offset for DAC1 CW generator

SAR1_SAMPLE_BIT.description: 00: for 9-bit width  01: for 10-bit width  10: for 11-bit width  11: for 12-bit width

SAR1_DIG_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC1 controlled by DIG ADC1 CTRL  0: SAR ADC1 controlled by RTC ADC1 CTRL

SAR2_PWDET_CCT.description: SAR2_PWDET_CCT  PA power detector capacitance tuning.

ULP_CP_FORCE_START_TOP.description: 1: ULP-coprocessor is started by SW  0: ULP-coprocessor is started by timer

ULP_CP_START_TOP.description: Write 1 to start ULP-coprocessor  only active when reg_ulp_cp_force_start_top = 1

TSENS_POWER_UP_FORCE.description: 1: dump out & power up controlled by SW  0: by FSM

TSENS_DUMP_OUT.description: temperature sensor dump out  only active when reg_tsens_power_up_force = 1

SAR_I2C_CTRL.description: I2C control data  only active when reg_sar_i2c_start_force = 1

SAR_I2C_START.description: start I2C  only active when reg_sar_i2c_start_force = 1

SAR_I2C_START_FORCE.description: 1: I2C started by SW  0: I2C started by FSM

MEAS1_START_SAR.description: SAR ADC1 controller (in RTC) starts conversion  only active when reg_meas1_start_force = 1

MEAS1_START_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC1 controller (in RTC) is started by SW  0: SAR ADC1 controller is started by ULP-coprocessor

SAR1_EN_PAD.description: SAR ADC1 pad enable bitmap  only active when reg_sar1_en_pad_force = 1

SAR1_EN_PAD_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC1 pad enable bitmap is controlled by SW  0: SAR ADC1 pad enable bitmap is controlled by ULP-coprocessor

TOUCH_XPD_WAIT.description: the waiting cycles (in 8MHz) between TOUCH_START and TOUCH_XPD

TOUCH_OUT_SEL.description: 1: when the counter is greater then the threshold  the touch pad is considered as "touched"  0: when the counter is less than the threshold  the touch pad is considered as "touched"

TOUCH_OUT_1EN.description: 1: wakeup interrupt is generated if SET1 is "touched"  0: wakeup interrupt is generated only if SET1 & SET2 is both "touched"

XPD_HALL_FORCE.description: 1: XPD HALL is controlled by SW. 0: XPD HALL is controlled by FSM in ULP-coprocessor

HALL_PHASE_FORCE.description: 1: HALL PHASE is controlled by SW  0: HALL PHASE is controlled by FSM in ULP-coprocessor

TOUCH_MEAS_EN.description: 10-bit register to indicate which pads are "touched"

TOUCH_MEAS_DONE.description: fsm set 1 to indicate touch touch meas is done

TOUCH_START_FSM_EN.description: 1: TOUCH_START & TOUCH_XPD is controlled by touch fsm  0: TOUCH_START & TOUCH_XPD is controlled by registers

TOUCH_START_EN.description: 1: start touch fsm  valid when reg_touch_start_force is set

TOUCH_START_FORCE.description: 1: to start touch fsm by SW  0: to start touch fsm by timer

TOUCH_PAD_WORKEN.description: Bitmap defining the working set during the measurement.

TOUCH_PAD_OUTEN2.description: Bitmap defining SET2 for generating wakeup interrupt. SET2 is "touched" only if at least one of touch pad in SET2 is "touched".

TOUCH_PAD_OUTEN1.description: Bitmap defining SET1 for generating wakeup interrupt. SET1 is "touched" only if at least one of touch pad in SET1 is "touched".

SAR2_SAMPLE_BIT.description: 00: for 9-bit width  01: for 10-bit width  10: for 11-bit width  11: for 12-bit width

SAR2_DIG_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC2 controlled by DIG ADC2 CTRL or PWDET CTRL  0: SAR ADC2 controlled by RTC ADC2 CTRL

MEAS2_START_SAR.description: SAR ADC2 controller (in RTC) starts conversion  only active when reg_meas2_start_force = 1

MEAS2_START_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC2 controller (in RTC) is started by SW  0: SAR ADC2 controller is started by ULP-coprocessor

SAR2_EN_PAD.description: SAR ADC2 pad enable bitmap  only active when reg_sar2_en_pad_force = 1

SAR2_EN_PAD_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC2 pad enable bitmap is controlled by SW  0: SAR ADC2 pad enable bitmap is controlled by ULP-coprocessor

SW_FSTEP.description: frequency step for CW generator  can be used to adjust the frequency

SW_TONE_EN.description: 1: enable CW generator  0: disable CW generator

DAC_DIG_FORCE.description: 1: DAC1 & DAC2 use DMA  0: DAC1 & DAC2 do not use DMA

DAC_DC1.description: DC offset for DAC1 CW generator

DAC_DC2.description: DC offset for DAC2 CW generator

DAC_SCALE1.description: 00: no scale  01: scale to 1/2  10: scale to 1/4  scale to 1/8

DAC_SCALE2.description: 00: no scale  01: scale to 1/2  10: scale to 1/4  scale to 1/8

DAC_INV1.description: 00: do not invert any bits  01: invert all bits  10: invert MSB  11: invert all bits except MSB

DAC_INV2.description: 00: do not invert any bits  01: invert all bits  10: invert MSB  11: invert all bits except MSB

DAC_CW_EN1.description: 1: to select CW generator as source to PDAC1_DAC[7:0]  0: to select register reg_pdac1_dac[7:0] as source to PDAC1_DAC[7:0]

DAC_CW_EN2.description: 1: to select CW generator as source to PDAC2_DAC[7:0]  0: to select register reg_pdac2_dac[7:0] as source to PDAC2_DAC[7:0]

CMD.description: program erase resume bit  program erase suspend operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

CTRL.description: For SPI1  initialize crc32 module before writing encrypted data to flash. Active low.

CTRL1.description: Delay cycles of resume Flash when resume Flash is enable by spi clock.

RD_STATUS.description: In the slave mode, it is the status for master to read out.

CTRL2.description: (cycles-1) of ¡°prepare¡± phase by spi clock, this bits combined with spi_cs_setup bit.

CLOCK.description: In the master mode it must be equal to spi_clkcnt_N. In the slave mode it must be 0.

USER.description: Set the bit to enable full duplex communication. 1: enable 0: disable.

USER1.description: The length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

MOSI_DLEN.description: The length in bits of write-data. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

MISO_DLEN.description: The length in bits of  read-data. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_WR_STATUS.description: In the slave mode this register are the status register for the master to write into. In the master mode this register are the higher 32bits in the 64 bits address condition.

PIN.description: SPI CS0 pin enable, 1: disable CS0, 0: spi_cs0 signal is from/to CS0 pin

SLAVE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of read-buffer operation in the slave mode.

SLAVE1.description: In the slave mode it is the enable bit of dummy phase for read-buffer operations.

SLAVE2.description: In the slave mode it is the length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase for read-status operations. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

SLAVE3.description: In the slave mode it is the value of read-buffer command.

SLV_WRBUF_DLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in bits for write-buffer operations. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_RDBUF_DLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in bits for read-buffer operations. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

CACHE_FCTRL.description: For SPI0  Cache access enable  1: enable  0:disable.

CACHE_SCTRL.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode  spi dual I/O mode enable  1: enable  0:disable

SRAM_CMD.description: For SPI0 SRAM DIO mode enable .  SRAM DIO enable command will be send when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.

SRAM_DRD_CMD.description: For SPI0 When cache mode is enable it is the read command value of command phase for SRAM.

SRAM_DWR_CMD.description: For SPI0 When cache mode is enable it is the write command value of command phase for SRAM.

SLV_RD_BIT.description: In the slave mode it is the bit length of read data. The value is the length - 1.

TX_CRC.description: For SPI1  the value of crc32 for 256 bits data.

EXT0.description: page program delay time  by system clock.

EXT1.description: erase flash delay time by system clock.

EXT2.description: The status of spi state machine .

EXT3.description: This register is for two SPI masters to share the same cs clock and data signals. The bits of one SPI are set  if the other SPI is busy  the SPI will be hold. 1(3): hold at ¡°idle¡± phase 2: hold at ¡°prepare¡± phase.

DMA_CONF.description: The bit is used to reset in dma fsm and in data fifo pointer.

DMA_OUT_LINK.description: The address of the first outlink descriptor.

DMA_IN_LINK.description: The address of the first inlink descriptor.

DMA_STATUS.description: spi dma read data status bit.

DMA_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

DMA_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

DMA_INT_ST.description: The status bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

DMA_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The inlink descriptor address when spi dma produce receiving error.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The last inlink descriptor address when spi dma produce from_suc_eof.

INLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current in descriptor pointer.

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of next in descriptor pointer.

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current in descriptor data buffer pointer.

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: The address of buffer relative to the outlink descriptor that produce eof.

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The last outlink descriptor address when spi dma produce to_eof.

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current out descriptor pointer.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of next out descriptor pointer.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current out descriptor data buffer pointer.

DMA_RSTATUS.description: spi dma read data from memory status.

DMA_TSTATUS.description: spi dma write data to memory status.

FLASH_PER.description: program erase resume bit  program erase suspend operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.
