FLASH_PES.description: program erase suspend bit  program erase suspend operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

USR.description: User define command enable.  An operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_HPM.description: Drive Flash into high performance mode.  The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_RES.description: This bit combined with reg_resandres bit releases Flash from the power-down state or high performance mode and obtains the devices ID. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_DP.description: Drive Flash into power down.  An operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_CE.description: Chip erase enable. Chip erase operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_BE.description: Block erase enable. A 64KB block is erased via SPI command D8H.  Block erase operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_SE.description: Sector erase enable. A 4KB sector is erased via SPI command 20H. Sector erase operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_PP.description: Page program enable(1 byte ~256 bytes data to be programmed). Page program operation  will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done .1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_WRSR.description: Write status register enable.   Write status operation  will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_RDSR.description: Read status register-1.  Read status operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_RDID.description: Read JEDEC ID . Read ID command will be sent when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done. 1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_WRDI.description: Write flash disable. Write disable command will be sent when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done. 1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_WREN.description: Write flash enable.  Write enable command will be sent when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done. 1: enable 0: disable.

FLASH_READ.description: Read flash enable. Read flash operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done. 1: enable 0: disable.

FCS_CRC_EN.description: For SPI1  initialize crc32 module before writing encrypted data to flash. Active low.

TX_CRC_EN.description: For SPI1  enable crc32 when writing encrypted data to flash. 1: enable  0:disable

WAIT_FLASH_IDLE_EN.description: wait flash idle when program flash or erase flash. 1: enable 0: disable.

FASTRD_MODE.description: This bit enable the bits: spi_fread_qio  spi_fread_dio  spi_fread_qout and spi_fread_dout. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_DUAL.description: In the read operations  read-data phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

RESANDRES.description: The Device ID is read out to SPI_RD_STATUS register, this bit combine with spi_flash_res bit. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_QUAD.description: In the read operations read-data phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

WP.description: Write protect signal output when SPI is idle.  1: output high  0: output low.

WRSR_2B.description: two bytes data will be written to status register when it is set. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_DIO.description: In the read operations address phase and read-data phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_QIO.description: In the read operations address phase and read-data phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

RD_BIT_ORDER.description: In read-data (MISO) phase 1: LSB first 0: MSB first

WR_BIT_ORDER.description: In command address write-data (MOSI) phases 1: LSB firs 0: MSB first

CS_HOLD_DELAY_RES.description: Delay cycles of resume Flash when resume Flash is enable by spi clock.

CS_HOLD_DELAY.description: SPI cs signal is delayed by spi clock cycles

STATUS.description: In the slave mode, it is the status for master to read out.

WB_MODE.description: Mode bits in the flash fast read mode, it is combined with spi_fastrd_mode bit.

STATUS_EXT.description: In the slave mode,it is the status for master to read out.

SETUP_TIME.description: (cycles-1) of ¡°prepare¡± phase by spi clock, this bits combined with spi_cs_setup bit.

HOLD_TIME.description: delay cycles of cs pin by spi clock, this bits combined with spi_cs_hold bit.

CK_OUT_LOW_MODE.description: modify spi clock duty ratio when the value is lager than 8, the bits are combined with spi_clkcnt_N bits and spi_clkcnt_L bits.

CK_OUT_HIGH_MODE.description: modify spi clock duty ratio when the value is lager than 8, the bits are combined with spi_clkcnt_N bits and spi_clkcnt_H bits.

MISO_DELAY_MODE.description: MISO signals are delayed by spi_clk. 0: zero  1: if spi_ck_out_edge or spi_ck_i_edge is set 1  delayed by half cycle    else delayed by one cycle  2: if spi_ck_out_edge or spi_ck_i_edge is set 1  delayed by one cycle  else delayed by half cycle  3: delayed one cycle

MISO_DELAY_NUM.description: MISO signals are delayed by system clock cycles

MOSI_DELAY_MODE.description: MOSI signals are delayed by spi_clk. 0: zero  1: if spi_ck_out_edge or spi_ck_i_edge is set 1  delayed by half cycle    else delayed by one cycle  2: if spi_ck_out_edge or spi_ck_i_edge is set 1  delayed by one cycle  else delayed by half cycle  3: delayed one cycle

MOSI_DELAY_NUM.description: MOSI signals are delayed by system clock cycles

CS_DELAY_MODE.description: spi_cs signal is delayed by spi_clk . 0: zero  1: if spi_ck_out_edge or spi_ck_i_edge is set 1  delayed by half cycle    else delayed by one cycle  2: if spi_ck_out_edge or spi_ck_i_edge is set 1  delayed by one cycle   else delayed by half cycle  3: delayed one cycle

CS_DELAY_NUM.description: spi_cs signal is delayed by system clock cycles

CLKCNT_L.description: In the master mode it must be equal to spi_clkcnt_N. In the slave mode it must be 0.

CLKCNT_H.description: In the master mode it must be floor((spi_clkcnt_N+1)/2-1). In the slave mode it must be 0.

CLKCNT_N.description: In the master mode it is the divider of spi_clk. So spi_clk frequency is system/(spi_clkdiv_pre+1)/(spi_clkcnt_N+1)

CLKDIV_PRE.description: In the master mode it is pre-divider of spi_clk.

CLK_EQU_SYSCLK.description: In the master mode 1: spi_clk is eqaul to system 0: spi_clk is divided from system clock.

DOUTDIN.description: Set the bit to enable full duplex communication. 1: enable 0: disable.

CS_HOLD.description: spi cs keep low when spi is in ¡°done¡± phase. 1: enable 0: disable.

CS_SETUP.description: spi cs is enable when spi is in ¡°prepare¡± phase. 1: enable 0: disable.

CK_I_EDGE.description: In the slave mode  the bit is same as spi_ck_out_edge in master mode. It is combined with  spi_miso_delay_mode bits.

CK_OUT_EDGE.description: the bit combined with spi_mosi_delay_mode bits to set mosi signal delay mode.

WR_BYTE_ORDER.description: In command address write-data (MOSI) phases 1: big-endian 0: litte_endian

FWRITE_DUAL.description: In the write operations read-data phase apply 2 signals

FWRITE_QUAD.description: In the write operations read-data phase apply 4 signals

FWRITE_DIO.description: In the write operations address phase and read-data phase apply 2 signals.

FWRITE_QIO.description: In the write operations address phase and read-data phase apply 4 signals.

SIO.description: Set the bit to enable 3-line half duplex communication  mosi and miso signals share the same pin. 1: enable 0: disable.

USR_HOLD_POL.description: It is combined with hold bits to set the polarity of spi hold line  1: spi will be held when spi hold line is high  0: spi will be held when spi hold line is low

USR_DOUT_HOLD.description: spi is hold at data out state  the bit combined with spi_usr_hold_pol bit.

USR_DIN_HOLD.description: spi is hold at data in state  the bit combined with spi_usr_hold_pol bit.

USR_DUMMY_HOLD.description: spi is hold at dummy state  the bit combined with spi_usr_hold_pol bit.

USR_ADDR_HOLD.description: spi is hold at address state  the bit combined with spi_usr_hold_pol bit.

USR_CMD_HOLD.description: spi is hold at command state  the bit combined with spi_usr_hold_pol bit.

USR_PREP_HOLD.description: spi is hold at prepare state  the bit combined with spi_usr_hold_pol bit.

USR_MISO_HIGHPART.description: read-data phase only access to high-part of the buffer spi_w8~spi_w15. 1: enable 0: disable.

USR_MOSI_HIGHPART.description: write-data phase only access to high-part of the buffer spi_w8~spi_w15. 1: enable 0: disable.

USR_DUMMY_IDLE.description: spi clock is disable in dummy phase when the bit is enable.

USR_MOSI.description: This bit enable the write-data phase of an operation.

USR_MISO.description: This bit enable the read-data phase of an operation.

USR_DUMMY.description: This bit enable the dummy phase of an operation.

USR_ADDR.description: This bit enable the address phase of an operation.

USR_COMMAND.description: This bit enable the command phase of an operation.

USR_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: The length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

USR_ADDR_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of address phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

USR_COMMAND_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of command phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1)

USR_MOSI_DBITLEN.description: The length in bits of write-data. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

USR_MISO_DBITLEN.description: The length in bits of  read-data. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_WR_ST.description: In the slave mode this register are the status register for the master to write into. In the master mode this register are the higher 32bits in the 64 bits address condition.

CS0_DIS.description: SPI CS0 pin enable, 1: disable CS0, 0: spi_cs0 signal is from/to CS0 pin

CS1_DIS.description: SPI CS1 pin enable, 1: disable CS1, 0: spi_cs1 signal is from/to CS1 pin

CS2_DIS.description: SPI CS2 pin enable, 1: disable CS2, 0: spi_cs2 signal is from/to CS2 pin

CK_DIS.description: 1: spi clk out disable  0: spi clk out enable

MASTER_CS_POL.description: In the master mode  the bits are the polarity of spi cs line  the value is equivalent to spi_cs ^ spi_master_cs_pol.

MASTER_CK_SEL.description: In the master mode  spi cs line is enable as spi clk  it is combined with spi_cs0_dis spi_cs1_dis spi_cs2_dis.

CK_IDLE_EDGE.description: 1: spi clk line is high when idle     0: spi clk line is low when idle

CS_KEEP_ACTIVE.description: spi cs line keep low when the bit is set.

SLV_RD_BUF_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of read-buffer operation in the slave mode.

SLV_WR_BUF_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of write-buffer operation in the slave mode.

SLV_RD_STA_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of read-status operation in the slave mode.

SLV_WR_STA_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of write-status operation in the slave mode.

TRANS_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of any operation in both the master mode and the slave mode.

INT_EN.description: Interrupt enable bits for the below 5 sources

CS_I_MODE.description: In the slave mode  this bits used to synchronize the input spi cs signal and eliminate spi cs  jitter.

SLV_LAST_COMMAND.description: In the slave mode it is the value of command.

SLV_LAST_STATE.description: In the slave mode it is the state of spi state machine.

TRANS_CNT.description: The operations counter in both the master mode and the slave mode. 4: read-status

SLV_CMD_DEFINE.description: 1: slave mode commands are defined in SPI_SLAVE3.  0: slave mode commands are fixed as: 1: write-status 2: write-buffer and 3: read-buffer.

SLV_WR_RD_STA_EN.description: write and read status enable  in the slave mode

SLV_WR_RD_BUF_EN.description: write and read buffer enable in the slave mode

SYNC_RESET.description: Software reset enable, reset the spi clock line cs line and data lines.

SLV_RDBUF_DUMMY_EN.description: In the slave mode it is the enable bit of dummy phase for read-buffer operations.

SLV_WRBUF_DUMMY_EN.description: In the slave mode it is the enable bit of dummy phase for write-buffer operations.

SLV_RDSTA_DUMMY_EN.description: In the slave mode it is the enable bit of dummy phase for read-status operations.

SLV_WRSTA_DUMMY_EN.description: In the slave mode it is the enable bit of dummy phase for write-status operations.

SLV_WR_ADDR_BITLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the address length in bits for write-buffer operation. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_RD_ADDR_BITLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the address length in bits for read-buffer operation. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_STATUS_READBACK.description: In the slave mode  1:read register of SPI_SLV_WR_STATUS  0: read register of SPI_RD_STATUS.

SLV_STATUS_FAST_EN.description: In the slave mode enable fast read status.

SLV_STATUS_BITLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length of status bit.

SLV_RDSTA_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase for read-status operations. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

SLV_WRSTA_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase for write-status operations. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

SLV_RDBUF_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase for read-buffer operations. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

SLV_WRBUF_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase for write-buffer operations. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

SLV_RDBUF_CMD_VALUE.description: In the slave mode it is the value of read-buffer command.

SLV_WRBUF_CMD_VALUE.description: In the slave mode it is the value of write-buffer command.

SLV_RDSTA_CMD_VALUE.description: In the slave mode it is the value of read-status command.

SLV_WRSTA_CMD_VALUE.description: In the slave mode it is the value of write-status command.

SLV_WRBUF_DBITLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in bits for write-buffer operations. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_RDBUF_DBITLEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in bits for read-buffer operations. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

CACHE_REQ_EN.description: For SPI0  Cache access enable  1: enable  0:disable.

CACHE_USR_CMD_4BYTE.description: For SPI0  cache  read flash with 4 bytes command  1: enable  0:disable.

CACHE_FLASH_USR_CMD.description: For SPI0  cache  read flash for user define command  1: enable  0:disable.

CACHE_FLASH_PES_EN.description: For SPI0  spi1 send suspend command before cache read flash 1: enable  0:disable.

USR_SRAM_DIO.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode  spi dual I/O mode enable  1: enable  0:disable

USR_SRAM_QIO.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode  spi quad I/O mode enable  1: enable  0:disable

USR_WR_SRAM_DUMMY.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode  it is the enable bit of dummy phase for write operations.

USR_RD_SRAM_DUMMY.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode  it is the enable bit of dummy phase for read operations.

CACHE_SRAM_USR_RCMD.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode cache read sram for user define command.

SRAM_BYTES_LEN.description: For SPI0  In the sram mode  it is the byte length of spi read sram data.

SRAM_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: For SPI0  In the sram mode  it is the length in bits of address phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SRAM_ADDR_BITLEN.description: For SPI0  In the sram mode  it is the length in bits of address phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

CACHE_SRAM_USR_WCMD.description: For SPI0  In the spi sram mode cache write sram for user define command

SRAM_DIO.description: For SPI0 SRAM DIO mode enable .  SRAM DIO enable command will be send when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.

SRAM_QIO.description: For SPI0 SRAM QIO mode enable .  SRAM QIO enable command will be send when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.

SRAM_RSTIO.description: For SPI0 SRAM IO mode reset enable. SRAM IO mode reset operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done

CACHE_SRAM_USR_RD_CMD_VALUE.description: For SPI0 When cache mode is enable it is the read command value of command phase for SRAM.

CACHE_SRAM_USR_RD_CMD_BITLEN.description: For SPI0 When cache mode is enable it is the length in bits of command phase for SRAM. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

CACHE_SRAM_USR_WR_CMD_VALUE.description: For SPI0 When cache mode is enable it is the write command value of command phase for SRAM.

CACHE_SRAM_USR_WR_CMD_BITLEN.description: For SPI0 When cache mode is enable it is the in bits of command phase  for SRAM. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

SLV_RDATA_BIT.description: In the slave mode it is the bit length of read data. The value is the length - 1.

DATA.description: For SPI1  the value of crc32 for 256 bits data.

T_PP_TIME.description: page program delay time  by system clock.

T_ERASE_TIME.description: erase flash delay time by system clock.

ST.description: The status of spi state machine .

INT_HOLD_ENA.description: This register is for two SPI masters to share the same cs clock and data signals. The bits of one SPI are set  if the other SPI is busy  the SPI will be hold. 1(3): hold at ¡°idle¡± phase 2: hold at ¡°prepare¡± phase.

IN_RST.description: The bit is used to reset in dma fsm and in data fifo pointer.

OUT_RST.description: The bit is used to reset out dma fsm and out data fifo pointer.

AHBM_FIFO_RST.description: reset spi dma ahb master fifo pointer.

IN_LOOP_TEST.description: Set bit to test in link.

OUT_LOOP_TEST.description: Set bit to test out link.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: when the link is empty   jump to next automatically.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: out eof flag generation mode . 1: when dma pop all data from fifo  0:when ahb push all data to fifo.

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: read descriptor use burst mode when read data for memory.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: read descriptor use burst mode when write data to memory.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: spi dma read data from memory in burst mode.

DMA_RX_STOP.description: spi dma read data stop  when in continue tx/rx mode.

DMA_TX_STOP.description: spi dma write data stop when in continue tx/rx mode.

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: The address of the first outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set the bit to stop to use outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set the bit to start to use outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set the bit to mount on new outlink descriptors.

INLINK_ADDR.description: The address of the first inlink descriptor.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: when the bit is set  inlink descriptor returns to the next descriptor while a packet is wrong

INLINK_STOP.description: Set the bit to stop to use inlink descriptor.

INLINK_START.description: Set the bit to start to use inlink descriptor.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set the bit to mount on new inlink descriptors.

DMA_RX_EN.description: spi dma read data status bit.

DMA_TX_EN.description: spi dma write data status bit.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for outlink descriptor error.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for inlink descriptor error.

IN_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for receiving error.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for completing receiving all the packets from host.

OUT_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor .

OUT_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for sending a packet to host done.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for sending all the packets to host done.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for outlink descriptor error.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for inlink descriptor error.

IN_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for receiving error.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for completing receiving all the packets from host.

OUT_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor.

OUT_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for sending a packet to host done.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for sending all the packets to host done.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: The status bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ST.description: The status bit for outlink descriptor error.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ST.description: The status bit for inlink descriptor error.

IN_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for receiving error.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for completing receiving all the packets from host.

OUT_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor.

OUT_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for sending a packet to host done.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for sending all the packets to host done.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for outlink descriptor error.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for inlink descriptor error.

IN_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for receiving error.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for completing receiving all the packets from host.

OUT_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor.

OUT_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for sending a packet to host done.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for sending all the packets to host done.

DMA_IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The inlink descriptor address when spi dma produce receiving error.

DMA_IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The last inlink descriptor address when spi dma produce from_suc_eof.

DMA_INLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current in descriptor pointer.

DMA_INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of next in descriptor pointer.

DMA_INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current in descriptor data buffer pointer.

DMA_OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: The address of buffer relative to the outlink descriptor that produce eof.

DMA_OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The last outlink descriptor address when spi dma produce to_eof.

DMA_OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current out descriptor pointer.

DMA_OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of next out descriptor pointer.

DMA_OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current out descriptor data buffer pointer.

DMA_OUT_STATUS.description: spi dma read data from memory status.

DMA_IN_STATUS.description: spi dma write data to memory status.

RESET_MODE.description: This bit is used to configure the operating mode of the TWAI Controller. 1: Reset mode; 0: Operating mode.

LISTEN_ONLY_MODE.description: 1: Listen only mode. In this mode the nodes will only receive messages from the bus, without generating the acknowledge signal nor updating the RX error counter.

SELF_TEST_MODE.description: 1: Self test mode. In this mode the TX nodes can perform a successful transmission without receiving the acknowledge signal. This mode is often used to test a single node with the self reception request command.

RX_FILTER_MODE.description: This bit is used to configure the filter mode. 0: Dual filter mode; 1: Single filter mode.

TX_REQ.description: Set the bit to 1 to allow the driving nodes start transmission.

ABORT_TX.description: Set the bit to 1 to cancel a pending transmission request.

RELEASE_BUF.description: Set the bit to 1 to release the RX buffer.

CLR_OVERRUN.description: Set the bit to 1 to clear the data overrun status bit.

SELF_RX_REQ.description: Self reception request command. Set the bit to 1 to allow a message be transmitted and received simultaneously.

RX_BUF_ST.description: 1: The data in the RX buffer is not empty, with at least one received data packet.

OVERRUN_ST.description: 1: The RX FIFO is full and data overrun has occurred.

TX_BUF_ST.description: 1: The TX buffer is empty, the CPU may write a message into it.

TX_COMPLETE.description: 1: The TWAI controller has successfully received a packet from the bus.

RX_ST.description: 1: The TWAI Controller is receiving a message from the bus.

TX_ST.description: 1: The TWAI Controller is transmitting a message to the bus.

ERR_ST.description: 1: At least one of the RX/TX error counter has reached or exceeded the value set in register TWAI_ERR_WARNING_LIMIT_REG.

BUS_OFF_ST.description: 1: In bus-off status, the TWAI Controller is no longer involved in bus activities.

MISS_ST.description: This bit reflects whether the data packet in the RX FIFO is complete. 1: The current packet is missing; 0: The current packet is complete

RX_INT_ST.description: Receive interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates there are messages to be handled in the RX FIFO.

TX_INT_ST.description: Transmit interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the message transmitting mis- sion is finished and a new transmission is able to execute.

ERR_WARN_INT_ST.description: Error warning interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the error status signal and the bus-off status signal of Status register have changed (e.g., switched from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0).

OVERRUN_INT_ST.description: Data overrun interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates a data overrun interrupt is generated in the RX FIFO.

ERR_PASSIVE_INT_ST.description: Error passive interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the TWAI Controller is switched between error active status and error passive status due to the change of error counters.

ARB_LOST_INT_ST.description: Arbitration lost interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates an arbitration lost interrupt is generated.

BUS_ERR_INT_ST.description: Error interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates an error is detected on the bus.

RX_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable receive interrupt.

TX_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable transmit interrupt.

ERR_WARN_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error warning interrupt.

OVERRUN_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable data overrun interrupt.

ERR_PASSIVE_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error passive interrupt.

ARB_LOST_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable arbitration lost interrupt.

BUS_ERR_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error interrupt.

BAUD_PRESC.description: Baud Rate Prescaler, determines the frequency dividing ratio.

TIME_SAMP.description: The number of sample points. 0: the bus is sampled once; 1: the bus is sampled three times

ARB_LOST_CAP.description: This register contains information about the bit position of lost arbitration.

ECC_SEGMENT.description: This register contains information about the location of errors, see Table 181 for details.

ECC_DIRECTION.description: This register contains information about transmission direction of the node when error occurs. 1: Error occurs when receiving a message; 0: Error occurs when transmitting a message

ECC_TYPE.description: This register contains information about error types: 00: bit error; 01: form error; 10: stuff error; 11: other type of error

ERR_WARNING_LIMIT.description: Error warning threshold. In the case when any of a error counter value exceeds the threshold, or all the error counter values are below the threshold, an error warning interrupt will be triggered (given the enable signal is valid).

RX_ERR_CNT.description: The RX error counter register, reflects value changes under reception status.

TX_ERR_CNT.description: The TX error counter register, reflects value changes under transmission status.

TX_BYTE_0.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 0 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 0th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_1.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 1 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 1st byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_2.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 2 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 2nd byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_3.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 3 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 3rd byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_4.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 0 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 4th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_5.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 1 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 5th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_6.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 2 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 6th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_7.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 3 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 7th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_8.description: Stored the 8th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_9.description: Stored the 9th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_10.description: Stored the 10th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_11.description: Stored the 11th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_12.description: Stored the 12th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

RX_MESSAGE_COUNTER.description: This register reflects the number of messages available within the RX FIFO.

CD.description: These bits are used to configure frequency dividing coefficients of the external CLKOUT pin.

CLOCK_OFF.description: This bit can be configured under reset mode. 1: Disable the external CLKOUT pin; 0: Enable the external CLKOUT pin

FIFO.description: This register stores one byte data  read by rx fifo.

INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than (rx_flow_thrhd_h3 rx_flow_thrhd).

INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_full_int_raw when rxfifo_full_int_ena is set to 1.

INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rxfifo_full_int_st register.

INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rxfifo_full_int_raw interrupt.

CLKDIV.description: The register value is  the  integer part of the frequency divider's factor.

AUTOBAUD.description: This is the enable bit for detecting baudrate.

STATUS.description: (rx_mem_cnt rxfifo_cnt) stores the byte num of valid datas in receiver's fifo. rx_mem_cnt register stores the 3 most significant bits  rxfifo_cnt stores the 8 least significant bits.

CONF0.description: This register is used to configure the parity check mode.  0:even 1:odd

CONF1.description: When receiver receives more data than its threshold value.receiver will produce rxfifo_full_int_raw interrupt.the threshold value is (rx_flow_thrhd_h3 rxfifo_full_thrhd).

LOWPULSE.description: This register stores the value of the minimum duration time for the low level pulse. it is used in baudrate-detect process.

HIGHPULSE.description: This register stores  the value of the maxinum duration time for the high level pulse. it is used in baudrate-detect process.

RXD_CNT.description: This register stores the count of rxd edge change. it is used in baudrate-detect process.

FLOW_CONF.description: Set this bit to enable software  flow control. it is used with register sw_xon or sw_xoff .

SLEEP_CONF.description: When the input rxd edge changes more than this register value. the uart is active from light sleeping mode.

SWFC_CONF.description: when the data amount in receiver's fifo is more than this register value. it will send a xoff char with uart_sw_flow_con_en set to 1.

IDLE_CONF.description: when receiver takes more time than this register value to receive a byte data. it will produce frame end signal for uhci to stop receiving data.

RS485_CONF.description: Set this bit to choose rs485 mode.

AT_CMD_PRECNT.description: This register is used to configure the idle duration time before the first at_cmd is received by receiver. when the the duration is less than this register value it will not take the next data received as at_cmd char.

AT_CMD_POSTCNT.description: This register is used to configure the duration time between the last at_cmd and the next data. when the duration is less than this register value  it will not take the previous data as at_cmd char.

AT_CMD_GAPTOUT.description: This register is used to configure the duration time between the at_cmd chars. when the duration time is less than this register value it will not take the datas as continous at_cmd chars.

AT_CMD_CHAR.description: This register is used to configure the content of at_cmd char.

MEM_CONF.description: Set this bit to power down mem.when reg_mem_pd registers in the 3 uarts are all set to 1  mem will enter low power mode.

MEM_RX_STATUS.description: This register stores the current uart rx mem read address  and rx mem write address

POSPULSE.description: This register stores the count of rxd posedge edge. it is used in boudrate-detect process.

NEGPULSE.description: This register stores the count of rxd negedge edge. it is used in boudrate-detect process.

RXFIFO_RD_BYTE.description: This register stores one byte data  read by rx fifo.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than (rx_flow_thrhd_h3 rx_flow_thrhd).

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the amount of data in transmitter's fifo is less than ((tx_mem_cnttxfifo_cnt) .

PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the parity error of data.

FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects data's frame error .

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than the fifo can store.

DSR_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the edge change of dsrn signal.

CTS_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the edge change of ctsn signal.

BRK_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the 0 after the stop bit.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver takes more time than rx_tout_thrhd to receive a byte.

SW_XON_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives xoff char with uart_sw_flow_con_en is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives xon char with uart_sw_flow_con_en is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the start bit.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter completes  sendding  0 after all the datas in transmitter's fifo are send.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter has kept the shortest duration after the  last data has been send.

TX_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter has send all the data in fifo.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when rs485 detects the parity error.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when rs485 detects the data frame error.

RS485_CLASH_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when rs485 detects the clash between transmitter and receiver.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the configured at_cmd chars.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_full_int_raw when rxfifo_full_int_ena is set to 1.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for  txfifo_empty_int_raw  when txfifo_empty_int_ena is set to 1.

PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for parity_err_int_raw when parity_err_int_ena is set to 1.

FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for frm_err_int_raw when fm_err_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_ovf_int_raw when rxfifo_ovf_int_ena is set to 1.

DSR_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for dsr_chg_int_raw when dsr_chg_int_ena is set to 1.

CTS_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for cts_chg_int_raw when cts_chg_int_ena is set to 1.

BRK_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for brk_det_int_raw when brk_det_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_tout_int_raw when rxfifo_tout_int_ena is set to 1.

SW_XON_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for sw_xon_int_raw when sw_xon_int_ena is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for sw_xoff_int_raw when sw_xoff_int_ena is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for glitch_det_int_raw when glitch_det_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for tx_brk_done_int_raw when tx_brk_done_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the stauts bit for tx_brk_idle_done_int_raw when tx_brk_idle_done_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for tx_done_int_raw when tx_done_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_parity_err_int_raw when rs485_parity_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_fm_err_int_raw when rs485_fm_err_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_CLASH_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_clash_int_raw when rs485_clash_int_ena is set to 1.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for at_cmd_det_int_raw when at_cmd_char_det_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rxfifo_full_int_st register.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rxfifo_full_int_st register.

PARITY_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for parity_err_int_st register.

FRM_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for frm_err_int_st register.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rxfifo_ovf_int_st register.

DSR_CHG_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for dsr_chg_int_st register.

CTS_CHG_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for cts_chg_int_st register.

BRK_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for brk_det_int_st register.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rxfifo_tout_int_st register.

SW_XON_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for sw_xon_int_st register.

SW_XOFF_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for sw_xoff_int_st register.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for glitch_det_int_st register.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for tx_brk_done_int_st register.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for tx_brk_idle_done_int_st register.

TX_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for tx_done_int_st register.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rs485_parity_err_int_st register.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rs485_parity_err_int_st register.

RS485_CLASH_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rs485_clash_int_st register.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for at_cmd_char_det_int_st register.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rxfifo_full_int_raw interrupt.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear txfifo_empty_int_raw interrupt.

PARITY_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear parity_err_int_raw interrupt.

FRM_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear frm_err_int_raw interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear rxfifo_ovf_int_raw interrupt.

DSR_CHG_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the dsr_chg_int_raw interrupt.

CTS_CHG_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the cts_chg_int_raw interrupt.

BRK_DET_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the brk_det_int_raw interrupt.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rxfifo_tout_int_raw interrupt.

SW_XON_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the sw_xon_int_raw interrupt.

SW_XOFF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the sw_xon_int_raw interrupt.

GLITCH_DET_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the glitch_det_int_raw interrupt.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the tx_brk_done_int_raw interrupt..

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the tx_brk_idle_done_int_raw interrupt.

TX_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the tx_done_int_raw interrupt.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rs485_parity_err_int_raw interrupt.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rs485_frm_err_int_raw interrupt.

RS485_CLASH_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rs485_clash_int_raw interrupt.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the at_cmd_char_det_int_raw interrupt.

CLKDIV.description: The register value is  the  integer part of the frequency divider's factor.

FRAG.description: The register  value is the decimal part of the frequency divider's factor.

EN.description: This is the enable bit for detecting baudrate.

GLITCH_FILT.description: when input pulse width is lower then this value igore this pulse.this register is used in autobaud detect process.

RXFIFO_CNT.description: (rx_mem_cnt rxfifo_cnt) stores the byte num of valid datas in receiver's fifo. rx_mem_cnt register stores the 3 most significant bits  rxfifo_cnt stores the 8 least significant bits.

ST_URX_OUT.description: This register stores the value of receiver's finite state machine. 0:RX_IDLE  1:RX_STRT  2:RX_DAT0  3:RX_DAT1  4:RX_DAT2  5:RX_DAT3  6:RX_DAT4  7:RX_DAT5  8:RX_DAT6  9:RX_DAT7   10:RX_PRTY   11:RX_STP1  12:RX_STP2 13:RX_DL1

DSRN.description: This register stores the level value of the internal uart dsr signal.

CTSN.description: This register stores the level value of the internal uart cts signal.

RXD.description: This register stores the level value of the internal uart rxd signal.

TXFIFO_CNT.description: (tx_mem_cnt txfifo_cnt) stores the byte num of valid datas in transmitter's fifo.tx_mem_cnt stores the 3 most significant bits  txfifo_cnt stores the 8 least significant bits.

ST_UTX_OUT.description: This register stores the value of transmitter's finite state machine. 0:TX_IDLE  1:TX_STRT  2:TX_DAT0  3:TX_DAT1  4:TX_DAT2   5:TX_DAT3 6:TX_DAT4  7:TX_DAT5  8:TX_DAT6 9:TX_DAT7  10:TX_PRTY   11:TX_STP1  12:TX_STP2  13:TX_DL0   14:TX_DL1

DTRN.description: The register represent the level value of the internal uart dsr signal.

RTSN.description: This register represent the level value of the internal uart cts signal.

TXD.description: This register represent the  level value of the internal uart rxd signal.

PARITY.description: This register is used to configure the parity check mode.  0:even 1:odd

PARITY_EN.description: Set this bit to enable uart parity check.

BIT_NUM.description: This registe is used to set the length of data:  0:5bits 1:6bits 2:7bits 3:8bits

STOP_BIT_NUM.description: This register is used to set the length of  stop bit. 1:1bit  2:1.5bits  3:2bits

SW_RTS.description: This register is used to configure the software rts signal which is used in software flow control.

SW_DTR.description: This register is used to configure the software dtr signal which is used in software flow control..

TXD_BRK.description: Set this bit to enbale transmitter to  send 0 when the process of sending data is done.

IRDA_DPLX.description: Set this bit to enable irda loopback mode.

IRDA_TX_EN.description: This is the start enable bit for irda transmitter.

IRDA_WCTL.description: 1.the irda transmitter's 11th bit is the same to the 10th bit. 0.set irda transmitter's 11th bit to 0.

IRDA_TX_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of  irda transmitter's level.

IRDA_RX_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of irda receiver's level.

LOOPBACK.description: Set this bit to enable uart loopback test mode.

TX_FLOW_EN.description: Set this bit to enable transmitter's flow control function.

IRDA_EN.description: Set this bit to enable irda protocol.

RXFIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset uart receiver's fifo.

TXFIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset uart transmitter's fifo.

RXD_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of uart rxd signal.

CTS_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of uart cts signal.

DSR_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of uart dsr signal.

TXD_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of uart txd signal.

RTS_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of uart rts signal.

DTR_INV.description: Set this bit to inverse the level value of uart dtr signal.

CLK_EN.description: 1.force clock on for registers.support clock only when write registers

ERR_WR_MASK.description: 1.receiver stops storing data int fifo when data is wrong. 0.receiver stores the data even if the  received data is wrong.

TICK_REF_ALWAYS_ON.description: This register is used to select the clock.1.apb clock 0:ref_tick

RXFIFO_FULL_THRHD.description: When receiver receives more data than its threshold value.receiver will produce rxfifo_full_int_raw interrupt.the threshold value is (rx_flow_thrhd_h3 rxfifo_full_thrhd).

TXFIFO_EMPTY_THRHD.description: when the data amount in transmitter fifo is less than its threshold value. it will produce txfifo_empty_int_raw interrupt. the threshold value is (tx_mem_empty_thrhd txfifo_empty_thrhd)

RX_FLOW_THRHD.description: when receiver receives more data than its threshold value. receiver produce signal to tell the transmitter stop transferring data. the threshold value is (rx_flow_thrhd_h3 rx_flow_thrhd).

RX_FLOW_EN.description: This is the flow enable bit for uart receiver. 1:choose software flow control with configuring sw_rts signal

RX_TOUT_THRHD.description: This register is used to configure the timeout value for uart receiver receiving a byte.

RX_TOUT_EN.description: This is the enble bit for uart receiver's timeout function.

MIN_CNT.description: This register stores the value of the minimum duration time for the low level pulse. it is used in baudrate-detect process.
This register stores  the value of the maxinum duration time for the high level pulse. it is used in baudrate-detect process.

RXD_EDGE_CNT.description: This register stores the count of rxd edge change. it is used in baudrate-detect process.

SW_FLOW_CON_EN.description: Set this bit to enable software  flow control. it is used with register sw_xon or sw_xoff .

XONOFF_DEL.description: Set this bit to remove flow control char from the received data.

FORCE_XON.description: Set this bit to clear ctsn to stop the  transmitter from sending data.

FORCE_XOFF.description: Set this bit to set ctsn to enable the transmitter to go on sending data.

SEND_XON.description: Set this bit to send xon char. it is cleared by hardware automatically.

SEND_XOFF.description: Set this bit to send xoff char. it is cleared by hardware automatically.

ACTIVE_THRESHOLD.description: When the input rxd edge changes more than this register value. the uart is active from light sleeping mode.

XON_THRESHOLD.description: when the data amount in receiver's fifo is more than this register value. it will send a xoff char with uart_sw_flow_con_en set to 1.

XOFF_THRESHOLD.description: When the data amount in receiver's fifo is less than this register value. it will send a xon char with uart_sw_flow_con_en set to 1.

XON_CHAR.description: This register stores the xon flow control char.

XOFF_CHAR.description: This register stores the xoff flow control char.

RX_IDLE_THRHD.description: when receiver takes more time than this register value to receive a byte data. it will produce frame end signal for uhci to stop receiving data.

TX_IDLE_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the duration time between transfers.

TX_BRK_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the num of 0 send after the process of sending data is done. it is active when txd_brk is set to 1.

RS485_EN.description: Set this bit to choose rs485 mode.

DL0_EN.description: Set this bit to delay the stop bit by 1 bit.

DL1_EN.description: Set this bit to delay the stop bit by 1 bit.

RS485TX_RX_EN.description: Set this bit to enable loopback transmitter's output data signal to receiver's input data signal.

RS485RXBY_TX_EN.description: 1: enable rs485's transmitter to send data when rs485's receiver is busy. 0:rs485's transmitter should not send data when its receiver is busy.

RS485_RX_DLY_NUM.description: This register is used to delay the receiver's internal data signal.

RS485_TX_DLY_NUM.description: This register is used to delay the transmitter's internal data signal.

PRE_IDLE_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the idle duration time before the first at_cmd is received by receiver. when the the duration is less than this register value it will not take the next data received as at_cmd char.

POST_IDLE_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the duration time between the last at_cmd and the next data. when the duration is less than this register value  it will not take the previous data as at_cmd char.

RX_GAP_TOUT.description: This register is used to configure the duration time between the at_cmd chars. when the duration time is less than this register value it will not take the datas as continous at_cmd chars.

AT_CMD_CHAR.description: This register is used to configure the content of at_cmd char.

CHAR_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the num of continous at_cmd chars received by receiver.

MEM_PD.description: Set this bit to power down mem.when reg_mem_pd registers in the 3 uarts are all set to 1  mem will enter low power mode.

RX_SIZE.description: This register is used to configure the amount of mem allocated to receiver's fifo. the default byte num is 128.

TX_SIZE.description: This register is used to configure the amount of mem allocated to transmitter's fifo.the default byte num is 128.

MEM_RX_STATUS.description: This register stores the current uart rx mem read address  and rx mem write address

MEM_RX_RD_ADDR.description: This register stores the rx mem read address

MEM_RX_WR_ADDR.description: This register stores the rx mem write address

POSEDGE_MIN_CNT.description: This register stores the count of rxd posedge edge. it is used in boudrate-detect process.

NEGEDGE_MIN_CNT.description: This register stores the count of rxd negedge edge. it is used in boudrate-detect process.

CONF0.description: Set this bit to reset in link operations.

INT_RAW.description: when a separator char has been send  it will produce uhci_rx_start_int interrupt.

DMA_OUT_STATUS.description: 1:DMA out link descriptor's fifo is full.

DMA_OUT_PUSH.description: This is the data need to be pushed into out link descriptor's fifo.

DMA_IN_STATUS.description: This register stores the errors caused in out link descriptor's data packet.

DMA_IN_POP.description: This register stores the data pop from in link descriptor's fifo.

DMA_OUT_LINK.description: This register stores the least 20 bits of the first out link descriptor's address.

DMA_IN_LINK.description: This register stores the least 20 bits of the first in link descriptor's address.

CONF1.description: Set this bit to enable decoder to check  check_sum in packet header.

DMA_OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of out link descriptoir when eof bit in this descriptor is 1.

DMA_IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of in link descriptor when eof bit in this descriptor is 1.

DMA_IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of in link descriptor when there are some errors in this descriptor.

DMA_OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of out link descriptor when there are some errors in this descriptor.

AHB_TEST.description: bit2 is ahb bus test enable ,bit1 is used to choose wrtie(1) or read(0) mode. bit0 is used to choose test only once(1) or continue(0)

DMA_IN_DSCR.description: The content of current in link descriptor's third dword

DMA_IN_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of current in link descriptor's first dword

DMA_IN_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current in link descriptor's second dword

DMA_OUT_DSCR.description: The content of current out link descriptor's third dword

DMA_OUT_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of current out link descriptor's first dword

DMA_OUT_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current out link descriptor's second dword

ESCAPE_CONF.description: Set this bit to enable  0xc0 char decode when DMA receives data.

HUNG_CONF.description: This register stores the timeout value.when DMA takes more time than this register value to receive a data  it will produce  uhci_tx_hung_int interrupt.

RX_HEAD.description: This register stores the packet header received by DMA

QUICK_SENT.description: The bits are used to choose which short packet

Q0_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q0_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

Q1_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q1_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

Q2_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q2_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

Q3_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q3_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

Q4_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q4_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

Q5_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q5_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

Q6_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

Q6_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

ESC_CONF0.description: This register stores the seperator char  seperator char is used to seperate the data frame.

ESC_CONF1.description: This register stores the first substitute char used to replace the seperator char.

ESC_CONF2.description: This register stores the flow control char to turn on the flow_control

ESC_CONF3.description: This register stores the flow_control char to turn off the flow_control

PKT_THRES.description: when the amount of packet payload is greater than this value the process of receiving data is done.

IN_RST.description: Set this bit to reset in link operations.

OUT_RST.description: Set this bit to reset out link operations.

AHBM_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset dma ahb fifo.

AHBM_RST.description: Set this bit to reset dma  ahb interface.

IN_LOOP_TEST.description: Set this bit to enable loop test for in links.

OUT_LOOP_TEST.description: Set this bit to enable loop test for out links.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: when in link's length is 0  go on to use the next in link automatically.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: Set this bit to produce eof after DMA pops all data  clear this bit to produce eof after DMA pushes all data

UART0_CE.description: Set this bit to use UART to transmit or receive data.

UART1_CE.description: Set this bit to use UART1 to transmit or receive data.

UART2_CE.description: Set this bit to use UART2 to transmit or receive data.

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to enable DMA in links to use burst mode.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to enable DMA out links to use burst mode.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to enable DMA burst MODE

SEPER_EN.description: Set this bit to use special char to separate the data frame.

HEAD_EN.description: Set this bit to enable to use head packet  before the data frame.

CRC_REC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable receiver''s ability of crc calculation  when crc_en bit in head packet is 1 then there will be crc bytes after data_frame

UART_IDLE_EOF_EN.description: Set this bit to enable to use idle time  when the idle time after data frame is satisfied  this means the end of a data frame.

LEN_EOF_EN.description: Set this bit to enable to use packet_len in packet head  when the received data is equal to packet_len  this means the end of a data frame.

ENCODE_CRC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable crc calculation for data frame when bit6 in the head packet is 1.

CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock-gating for read or write registers.

UART_RX_BRK_EOF_EN.description: Set this bit to enable to use brk char as the end of a data frame.

RX_START_INT_RAW.description: when a separator char has been send  it will produce uhci_rx_start_int interrupt.

TX_START_INT_RAW.description: when DMA detects a separator char it will produce uhci_tx_start_int interrupt.

RX_HUNG_INT_RAW.description: when DMA takes a lot of time to receive a data   it will produce uhci_rx_hung_int interrupt.

TX_HUNG_INT_RAW.description: when DMA takes a lot of time to read a data from RAM  it will produce uhci_tx_hung_int interrupt.

IN_DONE_INT_RAW.description: when a in link descriptor has been completed it will produce uhci_in_done_int interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW.description: when a data packet has been received  it will produce uhci_in_suc_eof_int interrupt.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_RAW.description: when there are some errors about eof in in link descriptor  it will produce uhci_in_err_eof_int interrupt.

OUT_DONE_INT_RAW.description: when a out link descriptor is completed  it will produce uhci_out_done_int interrupt.

OUT_EOF_INT_RAW.description: when the current descriptor's eof bit is 1  it will produce uhci_out_eof_int interrupt.

IN_DSCR_ERR_INT_RAW.description: when there are some errors about the out link descriptor  it will produce uhci_in_dscr_err_int interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_RAW.description: when there are some errors about the in link descriptor  it will produce uhci_out_dscr_err_int interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: when there are not enough in links for DMA it will produce uhci_in_dscr_err_int interrupt.

OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT_RAW.description: when there are some errors about eof in outlink descriptor  it will produce uhci_outlink_eof_err_int interrupt.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_RAW.description: When all data have been send  it will produce uhci_out_total_eof_int interrupt.

SEND_S_Q_INT_RAW.description: When use single send registers to send a short packets it will produce this interrupt when dma has send the short packet.

SEND_A_Q_INT_RAW.description: When use always_send registers to send a series of short packets it will produce this interrupt when dma has send the short packet.

OUT_FULL.description: 1:DMA out link descriptor's fifo is full.

OUT_EMPTY.description: 1:DMA in link descriptor's fifo is empty.

OUTFIFO_WDATA.description: This is the data need to be pushed into out link descriptor's fifo.

OUTFIFO_PUSH.description: Set this bit to push data in out link descriptor's fifo.

RX_ERR_CAUSE.description: This register stores the errors caused in out link descriptor's data packet.

INFIFO_RDATA.description: This register stores the data pop from in link descriptor's fifo.

INFIFO_POP.description: Set this bit to pop data in in link descriptor's fifo.

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the least 20 bits of the first out link descriptor's address.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the out link descriptors.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the out link descriptors.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to mount on new out link descriptors

OUTLINK_PARK.description: 1£º the out link descriptor's fsm is in idle state. 0:the out link descriptor's fsm is working.

INLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the least 20 bits of the first in link descriptor's address.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: 1:when a packet is wrong in link descriptor returns to the descriptor which is lately used.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the in link descriptors.

INLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the in link descriptors.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to mount on new in link descriptors

INLINK_PARK.description: 1:the in link descriptor's fsm is in idle state.   0:the in link descriptor's fsm is working

CHECK_SUM_EN.description: Set this bit to enable decoder to check  check_sum in packet header.

CHECK_SEQ_EN.description: Set this bit to enable decoder to check seq num in packet header.

CRC_DISABLE.description: Set this bit to disable crc calculation.

SAVE_HEAD.description: Set this bit to save packet header .

TX_CHECK_SUM_RE.description: Set this bit to enable hardware replace check_sum in packet header automatically.

TX_ACK_NUM_RE.description: Set this bit to enable hardware replace ack num in packet header automatically.

CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to check the owner bit in link descriptor.

WAIT_SW_START.description: Set this bit to enable software way to add packet header.

SW_START.description: Set this bit to start inserting the packet header.

DMA_INFIFO_FULL_THRS.description: when data amount in link descriptor's fifo is more than this register value  it will produce uhci_dma_infifo_full_wm_int interrupt.

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of out link descriptoir when eof bit in this descriptor is 1.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of in link descriptor when eof bit in this descriptor is 1.

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of in link descriptor when there are some errors in this descriptor.

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of out link descriptor when there are some errors in this descriptor.

AHB_TESTMODE.description: bit2 is ahb bus test enable ,bit1 is used to choose wrtie(1) or read(0) mode. bit0 is used to choose test only once(1) or continue(0)

AHB_TESTADDR.description: The two bits represent ahb bus address bit[20:19]

INLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current in link descriptor's third dword

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of current in link descriptor's first dword

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current in link descriptor's second dword

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current out link descriptor's third dword

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of current out link descriptor's first dword

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current out link descriptor's second dword

TX_C0_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  0xc0 char decode when DMA receives data.

TX_DB_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  0xdb char decode when DMA receives data.

TX_11_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  flow control char 0x11 decode when DMA receives data.

TX_13_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable flow control char 0x13 decode when DMA receives data.

RX_C0_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  0xc0 char replace when DMA sends data.

RX_DB_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  0xdb char replace when DMA sends data.

RX_11_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  flow control char 0x11 replace when DMA sends data.

RX_13_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  flow control char 0x13 replace when DMA sends data.

TXFIFO_TIMEOUT.description: This register stores the timeout value.when DMA takes more time than this register value to receive a data  it will produce  uhci_tx_hung_int interrupt.

TXFIFO_TIMEOUT_SHIFT.description: The tick count is cleared when its value >=(17'd8000>>reg_txfifo_timeout_shift)

TXFIFO_TIMEOUT_ENA.description: The enable bit for txfifo receive data  timeout

RXFIFO_TIMEOUT.description: This register stores the timeout value.when DMA takes more time than this register value to read a data from RAM  it will produce  uhci_rx_hung_int interrupt.

RXFIFO_TIMEOUT_SHIFT.description: The tick count is cleared when its value >=(17'd8000>>reg_rxfifo_timeout_shift)

RXFIFO_TIMEOUT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for DMA  send data timeout

RX_HEAD.description: This register stores the packet header received by DMA

SINGLE_SEND_NUM.description: The bits are used to choose which short packet

SINGLE_SEND_EN.description: Set this bit to enable  send a short packet

ALWAYS_SEND_NUM.description: The bits are used to choose which short packet

ALWAYS_SEND_EN.description: Set this bit to enable continuously send the same short packet

SEND_Q0_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q0_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEND_Q1_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q1_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEND_Q2_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q2_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEND_Q3_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q3_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEND_Q4_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q4_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEND_Q5_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q5_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEND_Q6_WORD0.description: This register stores the content of short packet's first dword

SEND_Q6_WORD1.description: This register stores the content of short packet's second dword

SEPER_CHAR.description: This register stores the seperator char  seperator char is used to seperate the data frame.

SEPER_ESC_CHAR0.description: This register stores thee first char used to replace seperator char in data.

SEPER_ESC_CHAR1.description: This register stores the second char used to replace seperator char in data . 0xdc 0xdb replace 0xc0 by default.

ESC_SEQ0.description: This register stores the first substitute char used to replace the seperator char.

ESC_SEQ0_CHAR0.description: This register stores the first char used to replace reg_esc_seq0 in data.

ESC_SEQ0_CHAR1.description: This register stores the second char used to replace the reg_esc_seq0 in data

ESC_SEQ1.description: This register stores the flow control char to turn on the flow_control

ESC_SEQ1_CHAR0.description: This register stores the first char used to replace the reg_esc_seq1 in data.

ESC_SEQ1_CHAR1.description: This register stores the second char used to replace the reg_esc_seq1 in data.

ESC_SEQ2.description: This register stores the flow_control char to turn off the flow_control

ESC_SEQ2_CHAR0.description: This register stores the first char used to replace the reg_esc_seq2 in data.

ESC_SEQ2_CHAR1.description: This register stores  the second char used to replace the reg_esc_seq2 in data.

PKT_THRS.description: when the amount of packet payload is greater than this value the process of receiving data is done.
